summary:
Werkt jouw website wel voor jou? 

Misschien niet. Want:
- Je website staat wel online, maar verder doe je er niks aan;
- Je hebt geld gestoken in een nieuwe website maar je ziet geen verschil met de oude website;
- Je ontvangt geen telefoontjes, e-mails of bestellingen van mensen die op jouw website komen.

Het is tijd om je website weer voor je aan het werk te zetten. En daar kan ik je bij helpen. 

Hi, ik ben Jasper en ik help jou met het schrijven van webteksten die de juiste bezoekers binnenhalen zodat jij meer verkoopt. 

Iedereen moet vindbaar zijn voor zijn publiek. Maar ik zie vaak eenmanszaken en kleine bedrijven veel kansen verliezen met hun website. Ze hebben prachtige producten maar worden niet gevonden. En daar wil ik iets aan doen. 

=====

ðŸ“Œ WIE?

Ik help winkeliers, restauranteigenaars, koffie- en theezaken, juweliers, doe-het-zelf-zaken, bouwbedrijven, makelaars, maar ook zzpâ€™ers en kleine bedrijven met het schrijven van webteksten, productinformatie en blogs. Het doel? Jou veranderen in de oplossing die je klanten zoeken. 

Ook ondersteun ik bedrijven die een marketingteam hebben met het maken van een content plan, het schrijven van blogs en het redigeren van webteksten, of het schrijven van nieuwe teksten. 

ðŸ“Œ HOE?
Met mijn ervaring als SEO-specialist schrijf ik teksten die aansluiten op dat wat jouw klanten zoeken. In mijn teksten houd ik rekening met welke zoekwoorden het best passen bij wat jij wil verkopen, maar ook met de zoekintentie. Zo komen jouw webteksten in de handen van de juiste bezoekers. 

ðŸ“Œ DIENSTEN
Ik kan het volgende voor je doen:
- Redigeren van al bestaande webteksten;
- Het schrijven van geheel nieuwe webteksten en productinformatie;
- Een reeks blogs maken aan de hand van een content planning die we samen opstellen.

ðŸ“Œ CONTACT
Laat je website voor je werken. Mail mij op: [info@jasperlosekoot.nl]

skills: ['Teaching', 'Coaching', 'Social Media', 'Public Speaking', 'Photography', 'Personal Development', 'English', 'Nonprofits', 'Art', 'Non-fiction Writer', 'Blogging', 'Public Relations', 'Copywriting', 'Social Networking', 'Creative Writing', 'Event Management', 'Journalism', 'Publishing', 'Social Media Marketing', 'Writing']
summary:
Drs. Susan Marletta Hart (1971) bracht het begrip hooggevoeligheid naar Nederland en is uitgegroeid tot een internationale autoriteit op het gebied van hoogsensitiviteit. 

Marletta Hart is de bestsellerauteur van o.a. Leven met Hooggevoeligheid: van opgave naar gave, HSP & Stress (2017) en Werkboek Leven met Hooggevoeligheid (2019). Alle boeken van Marletta Hart geven inzicht in de hoogsensitieve persoonlijkheid in theorie en praktijk. Veel boeken zijn klassiekers en de everseller "Leven met Hooggevoeligheid" is inmiddels in de 32ste druk. 
Haar nieuwste boek, HSP op de Werkvloer (2022), geeft praktische adviezen aan leidinggevenden, HR medewerkers, HSP ondernemers en HSP werknemers om ziekteverzuim en burn out te voorkomen. 

Ze studeerde aan de Universiteit van Amsterdam en de Vrije Universiteit, behaalde een Bachelor in Bewegingswetenschappen en een Master of Science graad met onderzoek naar de bewegingsredenen van talkdeelnemers. Ze studeerde verder Chinese Gezondheidswetenschappen met een verdieping in Opstellingen, energetische groepsdynamica en oplossinggericht teamdevelopment. 

Als senior coach en trainer gaf Marletta Hart gedurende 20 jaar les aan tienduizenden HSP's door heel Europa. 
Marletta Hart heeft twee dochters en leeft en werkt in Nederland en Zwitserland.

"Leven met Hooggevoeligheid raad ik al mijn cliÃ«nten aan. Het boek is een life changer. Onmisbaar voor iedere HR medewerker, coach en therapeut." (A. van Doorn, psycholoog)

"Thuiskomen. Susan is een werkelijk een absolute topper. Zeer inspirerende trainingen waarbij het opvallend is dat dit zowel jongere mensen als oudere mensen raakt en hen het onschatbare gevoel van "thuiskomen" geeft.

In haar trainingen leerde ik met ontroering, kippenvel en diepe verwondering dat er vele anderen zijn als ik. Zeer veel dank aan Marletta Hart. Zij heeft me in mijn 40ste levensjaar in mijn werk en privÃ©leven een stuk zekerheid en rust gegeven waar ik vele jaren onbewust naar op zoek was." (K. Maarssen)

Wil je Marletta Hart in corporate inhuren voor een teamdag, teambuilding of lezing? Andere wensen? Neem gerust en vrijblijvend contact op via susan@natuurlijkhsp.nl

summary:
Positieve ontwikkeling is het sleutelwoord als ik een klus aanpak, iets organiseer, mensen aanstuur of luister. Of het nu om een gesprek gaat, het schrijven van een tekst voor iemand, een probleem of het overbrengen van informatie, steeds analyseer ik wat de rode draad is, welke wetmatigheid ik kan ontdekken en wat er nu werkelijk gezegd wordt. Met de mogelijkheden die dan zichtbaar worden, enthousiasmeer ik mensen richting constructieve oplossingen. Als het nodig is gooi ik een knuppel in het hoenderhok of stoot ik een heilig huisje om, omdat dit de weg is naar verandering en verdieping. Mijn doel hierbij is om mensen bij elkaar te brengen en hun talenten in te zetten.
Het spreken in het openbaar gaat mij goed af en is plezierig om te doen. Ik hou van schrijven en de schoonheid van taal, maar niet van onnodig ingewikkeld doen. Werken met mensen die open en kritisch durven te denken ervaar ik als een verrijking. Hierbij hecht ik belang aan menselijkheid en heb ik oog en zorg voor het grotere geheel. Een dynamische werkomgeving houdt mij scherp, geÃ¯nteresseerd en gedreven. De mogelijkheid om de ander werkelijk te ontmoeten en van daaruit te zien wat iemand nodig heeft, maakt werk waardevol en zinvol voor mij. Heb je een creatief persoon een meedenker en soms dwarsdenker nodig, dan ben ik er voor jou!

summary:
When I was trying to figure out what part of the communication field I wanted to specialize in, a coach said to me, "It's okay to be a generalist, if this is what you excel at." I realized that this is what I want to be and began to specialize in being exactly that, a generalist. I am someone who can help you with many different aspects of communication. I love a challenge and always give everything. Because of this, I make sure that I turn any challenge or adventure that I step into a success.

I am a communication professional with different specializations in communication. For example, I graduated in communication science in July 2022, from Radboud University Nijmegen. Before that, I obtained my communication bachelor's degree at Fontys Hogeschool in Eindhoven. I learned to master the various psychological and practical aspects of communication during my studies. This ranges from setting up a social media campaign or creating a brand strategy, and understanding customer mindsets to positioning and branding a company, writing a communication plan for a new business, or dealing with cross-cultural relationships. These are also some of my favorite things within communications.

During my studies, I had experiences in Mexico and the United States. These experiences taught me how to become more aware of cultural differences and how to respond to them as a communication professional. Here I also learned how to work in a hectic environment, partly by graduating during the COVID-19 pandemic in a foreign country and completing a master's degree in uncertain times. This has ensured that I know how to handle stress and chaos, and still deliver a quality product. I am proud of this because it shows my perseverance and eye for detail.

During my studies, I worked as a social media manager, and I still do today. Here I help companies set up a comprehensive, executable social media plan with which they can achieve business goals. These goals can vary from more brand awareness to more customers or a better connection with regular customers. I also work as a copywriter where I help businesses write blogs, newsletters, website copy, and other textual content.

If you are interested in working with me don't hesitate to contact me. Also, be sure to check out my website for, among other things, my resume: evikerckhoffs.wixsite.com/cvportfolio.

name: Rachel Germans
skills: ['* Het schrijven van human interest verhalen', '* het beoordelen van human interest verhalen', '* plannen', '* creatief', '* klantgericht']
summary:
Na jarenlang werkzaam te zijn geweest in de journalistiek, ben ik onlangs een nieuw pad ingeslagen: ondernemen! Samen met vriendin en collega Claudy van der Walle heb ik ZakkieZ ontwikkeld. ZakkieZ maakt voelzakjes voor kinderen om spelenderwijs te leren: cijfers, letters, geometrische vormen, fruit, groenten, voertuigen... De mogelijkheden zijn eindeloos! 
Tijdens dit proces werden wij door iemand die werkzaam is in de dementerende zorg, gewezen op nog een heel mooie toepassing van onze ZakkieZ. Zo werd het zakje vol herinneringen geboren: een open of gesloten zakje met kleine voorwerpen die herinneringen kunnen oproepen aan vroeger. Dit kunnen algemene voorwerpen zijn (een cent, een rozenkrans), maar ook specifieke spulletjes die echt iets vertellen over het leven dat iemand heeft geleefd (een foto, een dobber omdat iemand graag viste of een vingerhoedje voor iemand die prachtig kon naaien). In een bijbehorend boekje staat kort de specifieke herinnering beschreven. Dat maakt dat verzorgenden en vrijwilligers heel makkelijk een gesprekonderwerp kunnen vinden dat echt aansluit bij de dementerende. We hebben zelf meerdere keren mogen ervaren dat er dan nog sprake kan zijn van echt contact.

Ik ben een maatschappelijk betrokken journalist met een achtergrond in genderstudies, een kritische blik en een voorliefde voor interviewen. Mijn opdrachtgevers zijn onder meer De Correspondent, de Volkskrant, De Groene Amsterdammer, OneWorld Magazine, Het Parool, Knack en Psychologie Magazine. Of het nou gaat om het tepeltaboe op Instagram, of #MeToo heeft geleid tot â€˜trial by mediaâ€™ of de strijd om de baarmoeder van de vrouw in Uganda â€“ ik zoek altijd een originele invalshoek en de perfecte bron om ingewikkelde verhalen tot leven brengen.

Bij Stichting Democratie & Media - een fonds dat journalistiek, media-innovatie en democratische vernieuwing ondersteunt - ben ik extern adviseur en mede-beoordelaar in de aanvraagrondes. Daarin gebruik ik mijn expertise op het vlak van journalistiek en gender.

Daarnaast werk ik aan een podcast over het premenstrueel syndroom, getiteld Bloedsjagrijnig. Voor NU.nl presenteerde ik de ondernemerspodcast Andermans Zaken.

Als gespreksleider en moderator ben ik te vinden bij Tivoli-Vredenburg, Breda Photo Festival, Theater Bellevue, Brainwash Festival en Pakhuis de Zwijger. Ik was spreker bij IepenUP Live, FOTODOK Utrecht en Welcome to the Village 2017. Af en toe geef ik college over gender en de maatschappij, bijvoorbeeld op de Radboud Universiteit Nijmegen, University College Utrecht en de Hogeschool voor de Kunsten in Utrecht.

Wil je mij graag bereiken? Stuur dan een e-mail naar info@juliamedia.nl

In 2019 waag ik een sprong in het diepe en begin ik mijn eigen onderneming onder de noemer 'Julia Media'. Een creatief mediabureau voor journalistieke producties. Bij Julia Media combineer ik mijn journalistieke achtergrond met de ervaring die ik heb opgedaan binnen het maatschappelijk werkveld om zo toffe dingen te kunnen maken!  

Die ervaring in het maatschappelijke werkveld doe ik op als ik na mijn afstuderen aan de School voor Journalistiek in Utrecht, lichtelijk afwijk van mij studiekeuze. Ik besluit me te oriÃ«nteren op het gebied van maatschappelijk werk. Vanuit die visie komt ik bij Stichting Talent and Dreams (STAD)  terecht, waar ik jongeren begeleid bij het opzetten van culturele en maatschappelijke initiatieven.

Maar in 2019 gaat de journalistieke passie weer kriebelen en ga ik wederom aan het werk als freelance journalist. Sindsdien werk ik voor verschillende opdrachtgevers en schrijf ik over allerlei onderwerpen. Met mijn maatschappelijke achtergrond en passie voor schrijven maak ik het liefst verhalen over verschillende mensen. Mijn expertise ligt dan ook bij interviews en het maken van portretten. Verder maak ik ook graag reportages en achtergrondverhalen over maatschappelijk gerelateerde themaâ€™s.

Huub Evers (1947) is zelfstandig onderzoeker en publicist op het terrein van de media-ethiek en de interculturele journalistiek. Daarnaast verzorgt hij lezingen en inleidingen over media en ethiek, vrijheid van meningsuiting, diversiteit en media etc. Zie ook de website: www.huubeversmediaethiek.nl 

Tot 2012 was hij lector â€˜Interculturaliteit en Journalistieke Kwaliteitâ€™ en hoofddocent Media-ethiek aan Fontys Hogeschool Journalistiek in Tilburg. Hij was gastdocent aan een groot aantal onderwijsinstellingen in binnen- en buitenland. 

Hij promoveerde in 1987 aan de Vrije Universiteit op een proefschrift over ethische normen in de uitspraken van de Raad voor de Journalistiek. Hij publiceert geregeld in kranten en tijdschriften over actualiteiten op het terrein van de media-ethiek en de interculturele journalistiek. Hij treedt veelvuldig op in de media als expert op deze gebieden. 

Hij is ombudsman bij De Limburger en lid van de Raad voor de Journalistiek.

Specialties: Media-ethiek en interculturele journalistiek

summary:
I am an Assistant Professor at the Centre for Media and Journalism Studies at the University of Groningen. With my research, often conducted in collaboration with news organizations, schools or libraries, I aim to understand people's changing news experiences, practices and preferences, and how they develop knowledge, skills and habits around the use of (digital) news and journalism. 

I translate this knowledge in the courses that I teach on audience studies, journalism studies, and qualitative research methods, in the BA Media Studies, MA Journalism/Journalistiek, MA Datafication & Digital Literacy, MA Social Media & Society and MA Media Creation & Innovation programs of the University of Groningen. I'm also internship coordinator for the MA Media Studies (looking for an intern in your company who could take up media-related tasks? Feel free to send me a DM!).

name: Marco Knippen
skills: ['Journalism', 'Television', 'Newspapers', 'Magazines', 'Sports', 'Tennis', 'Editorial', 'Investigative Reporting']
summary:
I am an allround journalist, but specialized in writing about sports, in all ranges: interviews, event coverage, reflections, opinion pieces and investigative reporting. The events I covered includes the Olympics (several sports), world and European championships (athletics, gymnastics), grand slam tournaments, Davis Cup and Fed Cup (tennis). 

In 2016 I am awarded as the Sports Journalist of the Year 2015 by the Dutch Sports Press (NSP), as a result of the publication of a series of articles in August 2015 about the doping issue and corruption within athletics in Kenya and the database of the international athletics federation (IAAF) containing 12.000 abnormal blood values related to more then 5000 athletes world wide. The publications, in cooperation with the German broadcasting company ARD/ZDF (Kenyan part and IAAF-database) and The Sunday Times (IAAF-database) led to judicial investigations, suspensions of officials and critical reports of the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA).

In 2021 the NSP Sports Scoop Award and De Tegel (category Interview) were hand out to me, as a result of the 'dossier gymnastics abuse'. In an interview in July 2020 the renowned Dutch coach Gerrit Beltman confessed decades of bullying and physical and emotional abuse to women gymnasts. He broke the taboo around transgressive behavior in sport.

In former days I also wrote about health care and education. 

My experience is not only concentrated on (daily) newspapers; I also wrote/write for specialized magazines and I worked for television.

Besides journalist I am a certified tennistrainer.

summary:
Ik heb altijd al geweten dat ik â€˜iets met taalâ€™ wilde doen. Wat dat â€˜ietsâ€™ moest zijn, wist ik nog niet toen ik Taalwetenschap ging studeren. â€˜Ietsâ€™ heeft taalkundig gezien geen meervoud, maar intussen wel in mijn leven: als taalwetenschapper doe ik onderzoek op het gebied van meertaligheid, laaggeletterdheid en taalstoornissen. Als taaldocent geef ik Nederlandse les aan nieuwkomers en taalleerders van alle leeftijden, van de basisschool tot studenten en volwassenen. Als schrijver, dichter en spoken word artiest gebruik ik taal om de wereld te duiden en verbinding te zoeken met een ander. Als docent creatief schrijven nodig ik mensen uit om op zoek te gaan naar hun eigen taal en verhaal. 

'Iets met taal' draait voor mij hierom: iedereen de mogelijkheden, keuzes en kansen bieden om hun eigen taal en verhaal te kunnen ontwikkelen. Ruimte maken voor thuistalen en de verhalen van de mensen met wie we samenleven, om tot een meer inclusieve en gelijkwaardige samenleving te komen. Daar is nog veel voor nodig: onderzoek, veranderingen in het onderwijs(beleid), een andere mindset en: creativiteit. Met alle 'ietsen' die ik doe en ben, zet ik me daarvoor in.

summary:
I am currently towards the end of my Research Master in Computational Linguistics / Natural Language Processing at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. After my Bachelorâ€™s studies in English Linguistics and Literature, my passion for language and my need to contribute to society's modern demands have turned me towards Language Technology. After all, I strongly believe that (personal) reinvention is the natural outcome of the world's continuous change. My current studies have armoured me with a broad perspective and interdisciplinary skill-set, while the research aspect made be adopt an inquisitive approach to everything, asking questions and working very thoroughly towards the answers. In the course of two years, I have worked with various NLP and Text Mining tasks, such as Sentiment Analysis, Named Entity Recognition, Topic Modelling and Classification, Semantic Role Labelling, Argumentation and Opinion Mining, Coreference Resolution and Conversational Agents. I also took a number of extracurricular course in Knowledge Organization and Data Mining Techniques, where I acquired knowledge in structured databases and worked on a hotel recommender system. Through these tasks I also gained a strong Machine Learning and Deep Learning knowledge. I mostly work in the Python programming Language, but I also have basic experience in R and Java. Finally, during my studies I worked in multiple Teaching Assistant positions that deepened my skills and confidence in them. 


This challenging transition from Linguistics to NLP gave me a strong learning drive and mindset and made me a strong proponent of bridging Humanities with STEM subjects. Every day of my studies is a confirmation of how significant linguistic insight is into making automatic systems more robust, efficient, generalizable and interpretable. At the same time, I also found myself leaning towards the engineering aspect, which is what I intend to pursue careerwise and combine with my linguistic background for a well-rounded and efficient execution.

summary:
Ever since I was a child, I always had a passion for science, fluid flows and combustion. This manifested itself in creating small machines with Knex or Lego, building dams in water streams and almost setting the house on fire when playing with fire. This passion developed further when I grew up and eventually resulted in me applying for a bachelor mechanical engineering at the Technical University of Eindhoven (TU/e). 

During my studies I came to the conclusion that I want to use my technical knowledge to contribute in solving the current energy problem and make the world a better place. This is the reason I joined the student team SOLID, who deals with the energy problem by storing green energy in iron powder. In two years I gained a lot of practical knowledge on working in large scale projects with the TU/e and technical partners from the industry. 

Parallel to this, I managed to get my bachelorsâ€™ degree with an 8.5 for my thesis, which resulted in a job offer as a part-time research assistant at the University in the field of iron combustion. My tasks mainly include creating small and large scale geometries in CAD, converting the 3D models to a discretized finite volume mesh and setting up CFD simulations of cold and reactive, iron particle laden methane-air mixtures. 

To further specialize my interest in fluid flow and combustion I applied for a master mechanical engineering in the multiphase and reactive flows group at the TU/e. My practical modelling knowledge obtained from my university job together with my mixed courses in modelling, experimenting and elective courses in the artificial intelligence field I obtained a wide set of skills. 
Feel free to connect with me if my profile appeals to you.

summary:
I am a passionate mechanical engineer specializing in Thermal and Fluids Engineering. I learned about my passion for studying fluids during my first experience working in a laboratory during my bachelor's degree. I started doing simulations and experiments with refrigerator compressors, and at that moment, I figured out what I wanted to do for the next years: research.

By the end of my bachelor's, I also discovered another great passion of mine: traveling and meeting new people and new cultures. At that moment, I dived into the most difficult but at the same time the greatest adventure of my life: start a new life and continue my education abroad. I was awarded the Orange Tulip Scholarship, which financed my Master's degree in the Netherlands.

My Master's degree allowed me to meet people worldwide, specialize in fluid mechanics and discover myself personally and professionally. At the end of my Master's, I had the opportunity to do an internship at the Netherlands Aerospace Centre and do my Master's thesis researching laminar-turbulent boundary layer transition at the Wind Tunnel of the University of Twente. At the end of my Master's, I was invited to continue as a Ph.D. candidate at the University of Twente. Currently, my research involves aerodynamics and aeroacoustics. I experimentally investigate turbulent flows and noise generated by the interaction of turbulence with airfoil wings. The goal of my research is to understand and analyze the physical phenomenon behind the aeroacoustic noise generation in an effort to subsequently improve noise prediction models. These models are of great importance in the design of silent propellers, wings, and fans.

Good! is the organizer of:

summary:
Carolyn F. Strauss (US/NL) is a researcher, curator, and creative facilitator whose work traverses the fields of architecture, design, contemporary art, emerging technology, and social and environmental activism. She is interested in enabling spaces of inquiry and encounter through which an expanded realm of human potential is explored and developed, with a particular focus on creative practice as a catalyst for dialogue and new experiences. As director of Slow Research Lab, Strauss has engaged a network of thinkers and creative practitioners in a myriad of research-based programs, including collaborations with prominent museums, cultural organizations, and academic institutions. She regularly lectures, writes, and curates study experiences that share both the cumulative work of the platform and her own personal Slow understandings. She lives and works in Amsterdam.

Carolyn has curated exhibitions, organized public programs, done extensive teaching and curriculum development, and lectured widely in the US and Europe. She has collaborated with the Stedelijk Museum (Amsterdam), Yerba Buena Center for the Arts (San Francisco), Canadian Centre for Architecture (Montreal), Interactive Institute (Norkopping, SE), Noguchi Museum (New York), Willem de Kooning Academy (Rotterdam), Icelandic Academy of Arts (Reykjavik), Cranbrook Academy of Art (Cranbrook, US), KHIO Academy of Art and Design (Oslo, NO), ENSCI-Les AtÃ©liers (Paris), and the AIA Center for Architecture (New York), among others.


SUMMARY OF EXPERIENCE
â€¢ Research, curating, project development, facilitation
â€¢ Teaching, lecturing, curriculum development, coordination
â€¢ Writing about ideas, methods and impacts of design and creative practice

summary:
Nadine Roestenburg is a curator and researcher interested in the impact of digital technologies and the internet on art, design and society.

Her research links theories on post-digital art, post-internet art, and new aesthetics. Since the nineties, several new movements in arts have been defined that are related to the digital revolution and the internet. Computer art, digital art, code art, net.art and many other expressions were coined, yet none of them succeeded to take over the discourse of contemporary art. Today, all our actions are influenced by digital technologies, and we cannot imagine life without. Our world has become a hybrid reality where the analogue and digital are invisibly interwoven, and we move from online to offline with natural ease. Terms such as Post-digital Art and The New Aesthetic mark an era dominated by artists with a digital state of mind. Through a creative use of both the digital and the analogue as a medium, and a way of representing and gaining visibility, artists have created a new movement in which distinguishing between the online and offline are no longer of interest.

BIO:
Julia van Mourik is a curator and editor. As director of The One Minutes Foundation, she leads the platform for experimental video art that works closely with various arts education institutions in the Netherlands and internationally. And as director of Lost & Found, she leads the artist salons: an eclectic mix of visual art, video, performance, outsider art, amateur art, music, literature, design, science and more.
She is a member of the Supervisory Board of CREA, member of the Advisory Committee Multi-Year Policy Plan for Art and Culture The Hague 2025-2028, chair of the Advisory Committee on Project Subsidies for Culture of the city of Utrecht and advisor to Amsterdam Fund for the Arts.

Before that she was, among other things, financial director of Top Publishers, which publishes the magazines Fantastic Man and The Gentle Woman, and executive editor of Re-Magazine. She held advisory and board positions for, among others, the Amsterdam Art Council, China Central Academy of Fine Arts, city of Amsterdam, Netherlands Architecture Fund, Netherlands Film Fund and ReykjavÃ­k International Film Festival.
Julia van Mourik studied Publicity and Culture in Amsterdam and did residencies at Raid Projects Gallery in Los Angeles and Townhouse Gallery in Cairo.

summary:
I graduated from TU Delft with a Master's in architecture, and am currently looking for an entry-level position as an architect. My expertise is in design, visualisation and model making. Urbanism, sustainability, and technical detailing formed a key part of my projects, along with a personal interest in wooden structures and phenomenology in architecture. 

During my study I was a teaching assistant in drawing classes at two faculties, helping students with techniques of design by sketching and how to illustrate their ideas. I also did an internship, getting to try my hand at various stages in the design process, from drafting concepts to preparing models and presentation materials. I lived and studied in an international setting for most of my life. As such, I feel most at ease in novel situations and when surrounded by a diverse group of people, and I am comfortable working both independently and in a team. I enjoy learning languages and am fluent in English, Dutch, French, and Czech. 

Since graduating last year I indulged several side jobs to gain different experiences before searching for work in my field. Creating graphic artwork for musicians has for me been an exercise in how to work with clients, and exploring the extent to which design skills can be transferred from one area to another. As a case writer in the area of business and economics, I gained confidence in my writing skills, and saw how a willingness to learn allows one to appropriate what at first seems utterly foreign. Annemarijn is a writer, researcher, and curator of contemporary art currently based in the UK. Her passion for contemporary art started in Amsterdam, where she graduated with a BA in Media, Art, Design and Architecture and followed the MA program in Contemporary Art History at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. In 2019 she was admitted to the MA program Curating Art and Cultures (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam and UvA), from which she graduated in 2022. During her studies in Amsterdam, Annemarijn had the pleasure of refining her skills in a museum environment by working at the prominent Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam and Rijksmuseum Amsterdam as a curator in training. 

As a curator, Annemarijn is particularly interested in Engaged Contemporary Art with a predilection for Time-Based Media. Strongly influenced by a varied body of critical activist, feminist and socially engaged theory, she focuses on the intersections between nature, care, community, ecology, identity, gender, sexuality, language and the politics surrounding these topics. Through her practice, Annemarijn aims to employ art to create dialogue, connection, collaboration and social change in the age of climate emergency.

name: annet dekker

summary:
Annet Dekker is an independent curator and researcher. Currently, she is Assistant Professor Cultural Analysis & MA coordinator Archival and Information Studies (Media Studies) at the University of Amsterdam. She is also Visiting Professor and co-director of the Centre for the Study of the Networked Image at London South Bank University. She gives presentations and lectures at various national and international conferences, member of juries and advisory boards, and regularly contributes to peer-reviewed journals and edited volumes. Previously she worked as Researcher Digital Preservation at Tate, London (2014â€“16), and Fellow at The New Institute, Rotterdam (2014â€“16), a Core Tutor at Piet Zwart Institute (2011â€“16), Web curator for SKOR (Foundation for Art and Public Domain, 2010â€“12), was programme manager at Virtueel Platform (2008â€“10), and curator of exhibitions and artists-in-residence at the Netherlands Media Art Institute (1999â€“08). From 2008â€“14 she wrote her Ph.D. at the Centre for Cultural Studies, Goldsmiths University, London, under the supervision of Matthew Fuller. The thesis turned into the book Collecting and Conserving Net Art. Moving Beyond Conventional Methods, published by Routledge.

Iâ€™m a dutch UX Design professional that is specialized in Usability Engineering and Interaction Design for web & mobile apps. CRAFTMANSHIP
Building websites and creating content that makes an impact or helps your customers to easily achieve their goals can be quite a challenge. A first-year student in MSc Medical Informatics and BSc Medical Informatics graduate at the University of Amsterdam. Currently, I am looking for an international graduate internship about the sustainability of healthcare concerning its effects on the environment and quality of care (November/December 2023 - June 2024).

My decision to pursue the BSc and MSc Medical Informatics program was influenced by my interests, personal values, and the potential for growth and social impact in the field. I find it intriguing how technology can be used to improve the delivery of care, healthcare equity, and sustainability. The Medical Informatics program provides a comprehensive understanding of the healthcare system, which is essential for developing and implementing effective technological solutions. The program brings together healthcare processes & organization, technology, and data science to solve complex problems in healthcare. 

In terms of my strengths, I have a natural ability to stay organized and maintain clear communication within project settings. In addition, I have gained valuable experience in the field of healthcare through my work with qualitative research methods. While I have a strong foundation in this area, I am also eager to expand my knowledge and explore other aspects of the healthcare field!

skills: ['Middelbaar onderwijs', 'Lesgeven', 'Begeleiding van jongeren', 'Coaching', 'Engels', 'Nederlands', 'Schrijven', 'Kwantitatief onderzoek', 'Kwalitatief onderzoek']
summary:
Mijn interesse ligt bij alles wat met leren en onderwijs te maken heeft. Zodoende heb ik na mijn bachelor gekozen voor een masteropleiding Onderwijswetenschappen. Daar heb ik een sterke theoretische basis gelegd en wetenschappelijke vaardigheden ontwikkeld. Daarna wilde ik graag mezelf verder ontwikkelen in het onderwijs. Met veel plezier heb ik dan ook mijn eerstegraads lesbevoegdheid tot docent in de maatschappijleer en maatschappijwetenschappen behaald. Tijdens deze opleiding heb ik lessen mogen geven aan leerlingen uit havo 4, vwo 4 en vwo 5. 

Door mijn opleidingen en diverse nevenfuncties ben ik breed geschoold in zowel de wetenschappelijke kant als de praktische kant van het onderwijs. Mijn kwaliteiten liggen bij het ontwikkelen van creatief en effectief educatief materiaal dat verantwoord wordt door wetenschappelijke kennis en gebaseerd is op ervaring uit de praktijk. Naast het ontwikkelen van allerlei soorten lesmateriaal is het mijn passie leerlingen en studenten te begeleiden in hun persoonlijke, educatieve en professionele ontwikkeling. Dit doe ik vanuit de kernwaarden positiviteit, geduld en betrokkenheid.

name: Matthijs van der Scheun
skills: ['Practical', 'Problem Solving', 'Teamwork', 'Analytical Skills', 'Environmental Awareness', 'Empathy', 'Trade Shows', 'Presentation Skills', 'Calculations', 'Invoice Processing']
summary:
How did I end up where I am now? And where would I like to go? Let me briefly tell you my story. It starts in high school. At the time, I was a student who, the more I advanced into secondary education, didn't put too much effort into learning. I started with the highest level of secondary education, pre-university education (vwo), but after 4 years I went one level lower (havo). The amount of languages â€‹â€‹that you have to learn at vwo did not suit me. The havo however, I finished quite easily. 
And what then? After 6 years of secondary education you are at the start of your (student) career, without any idea what to do. Until then, I was always told what to learn and what to do, but now I suddenly had to figure it out on my own and decide for myself. A strange moment in my opinion, but I will come back to that. I started with a bachelor's degree in business economics, because that was the subject I was good at high school. 
After a while though, I slowly realized that economics wasn't the thing for me. After trying another bachelor's degree, I just didn't know what to do next. I talked with a career counselor and with some help, I formulated my mission: to bring people into harmony with themselves and their environment. My vision is that people should be able to develop and develop in a sustainable way. 
Of course, this mission and vision didn't just came out of thin air. I would like to help preventing (young) people encountering the same problem in education as I did. Therefore I wanted to gain knowledge about education and that's how I ended up at the Educational Sciences degree. 
To achieve my mission I have several goals and I want to mention three of them explicitly here. (1) I want to make the transition between primary, secondary and tertiary education less explicit and see it more as a continuous line of development. (2) Within education, the development (or subjectification) of people in the (learning) community should be the focus. Therefore, I do not want standardized differentiation in levels, but customized education at the individual level (see, for example, Agora education or the DOE040 school as inspiration). (3) In line with this, I want education to focus on the tasks (subjectification, socialization and qualification) and not on performances.

summary: I am a successful researcher with a diverse, creative background. As an academic archaeologist, I have over fourteen years of research experience. Since 2005, I have worked at research institutes and archaeological projects across the Middle East (Turkey, Syria, Kuwait, Jordan), undertaking primary research, writing research reports (for government agencies, journals and the general public) contributing to multi-authored monographs and publishing original research articles for academic journals. I have presented my research at international conferences, university seminars, international research institutions and archaeological projects across the UK, Turkey and the Middle East. I am able to communicate my research to people from all backgrounds and of all ages, with a wealth of experience in public engagement activities. I have participated in various events aimed at widening participation to higher education, and directed educational activities at archaeological excavation open days. Currently working as the inaugural Postdoctoral Research Fellow at Leiden University's Netherlands Institute for the Near East (NINO); https://www.nino-leiden.nl/staffmember/dr-le-bennison-chapman.

summary:
My research is centred on the history of ancient medicine in all its aspects, and at all times in its social and cultural context. Attention to the patientâ€™s history belongs in this context. What did it mean to be ill in Graeco-Roman Antiquity? How did patients and doctors communicate? How can we grasp the different rationalities that were active in ancient medicine? I am also interested in the history of ideas. Medical anatomical and and physiological concepts, ideas and terminology play an important role as they â€˜dripped downâ€™ into literature and society up to the Early Modern Era. My main research project is patientâ€™s history in a comparative perspective: â€žSeeing Patientsâ€œ.

Specialties: History of Ancient Medicine
Greek and Roman Historiography

summary:
Cultural Management:
Since 2009, I split my time between Greece and the Netherlands, being involved in the communication, project management and facilitation of various media and art projects, specializing in intercultural productions, digital platforms and offline events. In the course of the last 3 years, I have  been involved in the pre-production, the production and the post-production of audiovisual content for  Greek and Dutch media, such as documentaries, web-docs, radio & tv news broadcasts.

Occasionally, I work as a freelance art editor and curator of photo and visual media exhibitions, as well as an independent PR and communications consultant for theatres and individual artists from the fields of performing & visual arts.

Publishing Activities: 
During the last 15 years I work as a freelance translator, editor and proofreader of literature and texts relating to the Human Sciences. My main areas of specialization are Literature, History, Art History, Archeology, Museology and Visual Arts. Language Combination: EN-EL, IT-EL, IT-EN, NL-EL.

In addition, I work as a  professional reader, columnist, book reviewer and translator at various online and offline media of cultural and literary interest. Furthermore, I design and produce content for online & social media.

Academic Research: 
After the completion of my master's studies in Culture, Media and Communication with a specialization in Visual Culture my research interests  include Visual Culture Literacy as well as the use of Photography in Old and New Media. I am currently focused on representational tactics of photographic content in photobooks and exhibitions and the role of the visual document as cultural heritage.

Papers: "Our First Murder: Exhibiting Forensic Evidence outside the Police Archive",
2nd International Conference of Photography and Theory 2012 - Photography and Museums: Displayed and Displaying, Ayia Napa, Cyprus.

summary: I started my academic career at VU University (Amsterdam), where I obtained a Bachelorâ€™s degree in Latin and Ancient Greek Language and Culture. Having spent a year at KU Leuven University on an Erasmus scholarship during the initial stages of my education, I decided to return to Leuven for a master's degree in Linguistics, which I obtained with a specialization in Diachronic and Comparative Linguistics in 2016. Subsequently, I joined the Friedrich-Schiller-UniversitÃ¤t (Jena) as a Marie Curie Early Stage Researcher in the DComm project, studying for a PhD degree under the supervision of prof. Holger Diessel. In my thesis, which focused on demonstratives, I combined a typological investigation of demonstrative systems worldwide with a more in-depth study of the Latin demonstratives. Having finished my thesis, I joined the University of Amsterdam in September 2019 as a postdoctoral researcher in the Anchoring Innovation project, focusing on Latin. In my work, I aim to combine my knowledge of general linguistics and pragmatics with my passion for Ancient Greek and Latin literature.

summary:
Beste lezer, welkom op mijn pagina! Mijn naam is Kimberly Smits. 

Ik ben een gedreven tweedejaars rechtenstudent aan de Tilburg University. Tevens neem ik sinds dit jaar deel aan het honoursprogramma Topklas. De Topklas is een extra-curriculair programma van de rechtenfaculteit waarbij ik extra (juridisch relevante) vakken volg nÃ¡Ã¡st de reguliere bachelor vakken. Hiernaast ben ik, op vrijwillige basis, werkzaam als juridisch medewerker bij de Rechtswinkel Goeree-Overflakkee. summary:
'Zin geven aan loopbaan en levensloop door middel van memorabele zinnen en verhalen'

Dit is de kern waarmee ik bezig ben. Mijn uitgangspunt is dat het formuleren van mooie, originele zinnen en verhalen levenszin en perspectief kunnen bieden; in het zoeken naar een nieuwe baan, in het (opnieuw) zin geven van je levensloop. Ik zet me hiervoor in door individuele coaching, workshops, colleges, stagebegeleiding en het schrijven van blogs en artikelen.

Ik ben er inmiddels van overtuigd: 'iedereen heeft een sterk verhaal, alleen moet dat verhaal wakker gekust worden'.
In april 2021 kwam mijn boek uit: 'Ontdek je sterke verhaal'.  En in juli 2022 (samen met hoogleraar Oosterse religes, Paul van der Velde): 'Weg van het onbekende. De zin van het Niet-Weten'.

skills: ['Onderzoek', 'Cultureel erfgoed', 'Sociale media', 'Religie', 'Kunstgeschiedenis', 'Musea', 'Organisationele vaardigheden', 'Bibliotheek']
summary: Zo lang als ik me kan herinneren ben ik gemotiveerd geweest om te leren: of het nou om fietsen, lezen of autorijden ging, het maakte mij niets uit. Toch ligt mijn passie niet bij het praktische leren wat centraal stond tijdens mijn opvoeding op een boerderij, maar bij het leren uit de boeken, en deze kennis kritisch beoordelen. Tijdens mijn vwo-opleiding ontdekte ik mijn interesses voor religie, geschiedenis en kunst. Deze gebieden boeien mij omdat ik ze als fundamenteel zie voor de ontwikkeling van de geschiedenis van de mens, en de plek waar we nu als mens zijn. In mijn vorige opleiding Religiewetenschappen werden deze interesses gecombineerd. Nu ben ik bezig met het afstuderen van de Master Religion & Cultural Heritage waar mijn interesses voor religie, geschiedenis en kunst mijn specialisatie zijn geworden. Om alvast kennis te maken met de (werk)wereld van het vakgebied van cultureel erfgoed, ben ik student assistent van meerdere docenten van de MA Religion & Cultural Heritage, door zowel te werken voor het Centrum voor Religie en Erfgoed waar de docenten aan verbonden zijn, als voor Ã©Ã©n specifieke docent te werken. Tijdens mijn bachelor, was ik bezig met Honours College voor getalenteerde studenten aan de RUG, waar ik nog meer mijn liefde voor leren kon ontplooien, mij op andere vakgebieden kon oriÃ«nteren en andere invalshoeken kon ontdekken. Het volgen van dit programma illustreert perfect mijn gedrevenheid. Ik heb de keuze moeten maken om dit programma niet te volgen tijdens mijn master, omdat dit te druk zou worden naast de combinatie van het volgen van vakken uit mijn masteropleiding, het volgen van een extra vak, werken en op dit moment stage.

name: Bastiaan van Rijn
summary:
As PhD student at Bern, I am part of the Experiments with Experience project, which aims to discover just how the natural scientific concept of 'experiment' was used by religious and spiritual actors in Western countries during 19th and 20th-century to further their self-understanding of their own practices and beliefs. 

Apart from that, I am highly interested in the general systematic study of religion, as well as more particularly the practice of contemporary divination.

skills: ['Mental Health', 'Psychology', 'Psychiatry', 'Cross-cultural Psychology', 'Religious Studies', 'Islam', 'Dutch', 'German', 'Books', 'Translation', 'Text Editing', 'Writing', 'Communication']
summary:
Er lopen twee rode lijnen door mijn leven: betrokkenheid bij het psychisch welzijn van mensen en een grote liefde voor literatuur en boeken. Na mijn studie religiewetenschappen ben ik gaan werken als boekvertaler en freelance redacteur voor diverse uitgeverijen. Daarnaast was ik jarenlang werkzaam in de geestelijke gezondheidszorg. Toen door reorganisatie mijn functie als voorlichter in de ggz kwam te vervallen, koos ik ervoor me volledig te richten op mijn droom: literair vertalen. Vervolgens heb ik op de VertalersVakschool de tweejarige opleiding tot literair vertaler Duits-Nederlands gevolgd (in 2015 afgerond). 
Tot nu toe vertaalde ik vooral kinder- en jeugdboeken en non-fictie (hoofdzakelijk religie en psychologie). Dat doe ik met plezier, maar mijn vertaaldroom, het vertalen van literatuur, blijf ik najagen.

Ruim 10 jaar ervaring als bemiddelaar, praktisch filosoof en voorzittersfuncties. Soms tegelijkertijd. 
Als jongst geborene in een ondernemersfamilie, ben ik veelvuldig ingezet als vliegende keep en heb daardoor alle facetten van het (bedrijfs) leven ervaren. Door de soms conflicterende positie van de ondernemer ten opzichte van de omgeving heb ik mij verdiept in mediation. Er is altijd een andere oplossing.

Maatschappelijk gezien heb ik mij op landelijk niveau politiek ingezet op sociaal-economisch gebied. Met een focus op een UBI (Universal Basic Income) of een variant daarop. De huidige sociale regelingen voldoen niet.

Internationaal ben ik aangesloten bij P4C (Philosophy for Children) organisaties om te bewerkstelligen dat naast lezen, schrijven en rekenen, leren denken ook een plaats krijgt in de basis van het onderwijs.

Heb jij een plan of idee om vrouwelijke energie te bundelen?
Laat het me weten!

skills: ['Christian Theology', 'Biblical Studies', 'Church History', 'Religious Studies', 'Philosophy', 'Biblical Hebrew', 'Ancient Greek', 'Social Sciences', 'Conflict and peace studies', 'Development Work', 'Humanitarian Assistance', 'Public Health', 'Sociology', 'Psychology', 'Cultural Anthropology', 'Political Science', 'International Humanitarian Law', 'Qualitative Research', 'Research Design', 'Product Promotion']
summary:
At the moment I am working at the Dutch Ministry of Justice and Security as a policy advisor, on the reception of Ukranian refugees in the Netherlands. 

For 3,5 years I worked as Refugee Status Determination Officier at the Dutch Immigration and Naturalisation Agency (IND). The essence of my job was to ensure that those who had fled from persecution and serious harm received the international protection they needed. 

More generally, my interests lie in the fields of international humanitarian action & migration, peacebuilding, religion and human (LGBTI) rights. 

I have excellent skills in writing, analyzing complex information, creating and maintaining networks and building bridges between various fields, departments and disciplines. I like to look at the bigger picture and to travel off the beaten track.

---
My professional story, in brief, is as follows. 

After growing up as a Christian, I studied Theology (BA) in Amsterdam. The ethics and philosophy that filtered out of my Theology Bachelors led me into studying humanitarian action, conflict and peace-building (MA). 

The organization I interned at as part of my studies, the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, gave me a formidable sense of working at a larger funder and coordinator of humanitarian assistence.

I wrote my Master thesis about the political construction of 'Dutch Christian Self versus Migrant Muslim Other'. This made me more aware of the way violence and exclusion are legitimized in political discourse. 

I got the chance to witness dynamics of violence and exclusion in real life when, for two months, I volunteered at a farm in the West Bank owned by a Palestinian family. 

My volunteering job at the International Fellowship of Reconciliation gave me insight into the work of an international peace organization. Additionally, it  provided experience in applying for funding at the EU.

Furthermore, it was a great pleasure for me to volunteer at the Amsterdam Rainbow Dress Foundation, creating awareness on state sponsored homophobia. The Amsterdam Rainbow Dress is a work of art traveling around the world. I was part of a small team managing its exposition, and took part in fundraising efforts.

~~~

Striving to approach the world in a combined idealistic and realistic way, I am slowly becoming who I want to be. Someone whose presence and actions have a positive, transformative impact on the people I engage with. Someone who contributes to overturning unjust structures, making room for peace.

summary:
In September 2022, I started my internship at the Donders Centre for Cognitive Neuroimaging as part of the second year of my MSc Cognitive Neuroscience (Research). My thesis will be under the theme of 'Intention and Action',  led by prof. Ivan Toni, Arjen Stolk and Jana Basnakova. I'm excited to learn how to analyse eye-tracking and pupillometry information, as well as fMRI preprocessing and first and secondary analyses, all while using Matlab. Additionally, I will be assisting in running EEG experiments. 
On the side, I will be working at the Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics as part of the Language Development Department. My main tasks entail running experiments with children, coding data, all while in close interaction with the researchers. A minor part concerns writing lay summaries for the Baby and Child Research Centre. 
In my free time, I am working on a paper on the difficulties of children on interpreting while-clauses in Dutch by using eye-tracking. 

Graduated cum laude from University College Utrecht in July 2020, with an interdepartmental major with tracks in Linguistics and Psychology, with a minor in Cognitive Neuroscience. My thesis was titled 'Dyslexia: a Methodological Approach of the Evaluation of Treatments' in which the current practice for children with dyslexia was assessed in light of knowledge from the scientific literature.

As someone who has finished a Bachelor in both educational science, both a bachelor and Master degree in English Language and culture, and is currently finishing an Educational Master for the English language, I have a vested interest in both education and language.
I have been trained in multiple forms of research, included but not limited to: qualitative and quantitative research, applied research, conceptual research, empirical research, case study research, diagnostic research, literature research, and analytical research.
During both my Bachelor and Master in English Language and Culture, I have specialized myself in literature research, with a specific focus on the research of science fiction, fantasy, graphic novels, and horror. I am, however, well-versed in the research of the entire width of English literature.
During my Educational Master I have specialized myself in didactics, specifically online classroom didactics and student differentiation. Moreover, I have also specialized in education reform and the role of the student withing educational systems. Additionally, I have ample practical experiences in teaching multiple age groups, ranging from young children to adults. I have experience in teaching the English language in its broadest sense; Ranging from literature, to grammar, to academic writing.
During my Bachelor in Educational science, I have specialized in orthopedagogy and the treatment of children with developmental disabilities within the educational system as well as the attitudes of professional caretakers and the role of these attitudes in the treatment of children with developmental disabilities.
I work well in a team, and it is my goal to be a part of the progression of education, either nationally or globally.

Currently I am doing my PhD research in youth work and vocational education at the Catholic University Leuven as part of the SoLiDi European research project.

name: Ellen-Petra Kester
summary:
Dr. Ellen-Petra Kester is an Associate Professor of Spanish linguistics at Utrecht University. After receiving her Ph.D. from Utrecht University, she was employed at the University of Amsterdam where she continued her work on the syntax of Germanic and Romance languages. More recently she has been conducting research on the syntactic properties of Papiamento, the Spanish-Portuguese based creole language spoken on Aruba, Bonaire and CuraÃ§ao. 

Over the years she developed a strong interest in the language situation of the former Netherlands Antilles, where Papiamento and English, the mother tongues spoken by the majorities of the populations of the Dutch Leeward and Windward Islands, are co-official with Dutch. Since 2010 she expanded her research to language use, language attitudes and language policy  in relation to the multiple identities of the populations of the Caribbean island that are part of the Kingdom of the Netherlands.  

In 2013 Ellen-Petra Kester carried out a government mandated research project on the island of St. Eustatius, together with prof. dr. Nicholas Faraclas (University of Puerto Rico) and drs. Eric Mijts (University of Aruba), which led to a change in the language of instruction  in the education system of the island. 
In 2016 she joined a project funded by the Uitvoeringsorganisatie van de Twinningfaciliteit Suriname - Nederland (UTSN), developing a course as well as a manual on cultural diversity and multilingualism for teacher trainers in Surinam. 

Ellen-Petra Kester has been the coordinator of a Masterâ€™s program on multilingualism and language acquisition (Meertaligheid en Taalverwerving) since 2016 and also teaches courses on Spanish linguistics in the Bachelorâ€™s program on Spanish Language and Culture at Utrecht University. 

Since 2010 she has been a guest lecturer in the Masterâ€™s program for Education at the University of CuraÃ§ao, teaching courses and supervising studentsâ€™ research in the domain of multilingualism, language contact and language acquisition.

summary:
I am currently towards the end of my Research Master in Computational Linguistics / Natural Language Processing at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. After my Bachelorâ€™s studies in English Linguistics and Literature, my passion for language and my need to contribute to society's modern demands have turned me towards Language Technology. After all, I strongly believe that (personal) reinvention is the natural outcome of the world's continuous change. My current studies have armoured me with a broad perspective and interdisciplinary skill-set, while the research aspect made be adopt an inquisitive approach to everything, asking questions and working very thoroughly towards the answers. In the course of two years, I have worked with various NLP and Text Mining tasks, such as Sentiment Analysis, Named Entity Recognition, Topic Modelling and Classification, Semantic Role Labelling, Argumentation and Opinion Mining, Coreference Resolution and Conversational Agents. I also took a number of extracurricular course in Knowledge Organization and Data Mining Techniques, where I acquired knowledge in structured databases and worked on a hotel recommender system. Through these tasks I also gained a strong Machine Learning and Deep Learning knowledge. I mostly work in the Python programming Language, but I also have basic experience in R and Java. Finally, during my studies I worked in multiple Teaching Assistant positions that deepened my skills and confidence in them. 


This challenging transition from Linguistics to NLP gave me a strong learning drive and mindset and made me a strong proponent of bridging Humanities with STEM subjects. Every day of my studies is a confirmation of how significant linguistic insight is into making automatic systems more robust, efficient, generalizable and interpretable. At the same time, I also found myself leaning towards the engineering aspect, which is what I intend to pursue careerwise and combine with my linguistic background for a well-rounded and efficient execution.

summary:
After secondary school, I went to Leiden University to study English Language&Culture. Three years later, BA in hand, I specialised by doing a master's in English Language&Linguistics. I'm mostly interested in sociolinguistics with a hint of phonology: How are words pronounced, what do people think of that, does the region they live in influence their pronunciation? But basically everything that has to do with language and linguistics sparks my interest.

Since I didn't want to go into education, I had to find different ways to use my talents. I had already tutored many individual pupils in English and I am still occassionally doing this. I've been transcribing old manuscripts for Transcribe Bentham and also for Shakespeare's World. I am proofreading and editing for a student company (AthenaSummary & AthenaCheck) and have done some translation work as well. 

I worked at a homework institute for two years and I loved helping the pupils with their homework through explanation and rehearsing. At the start of 2016, I begun with two internships at Calvijn College: research and editorial. Through both internships I've specialised in directions that I'd love to work in, gaining the experience for future jobs.

Even though I didn't want to go into education, I'm still working close to that branche. Who knows what will happen in the future? For now, I'm focusing on editorial work, but I'd be happy to have any job that concerns language and/or linguistics.

Want to know more about me? Just ask!

name: Joris van Son
skills: ['Research', 'Writing', 'Public Speaking', 'Music History', 'Sociology']
summary:
As a music and cultural historian, I am interested in the stories behind cultural expressions in general and early music in particular. In my working life, I am fortunate to pursue my interests in two complementary positions: as a music archivist and as a PhD candidate.

At the Haags Gemeentearchief, I work in a multiyear project team to make the special collection of the Nederlands Muziek Instituut (1800-2020) accessible online. In my role, I make inventory descriptions of composer and musician archives, with an emphasis on the nineteenth century.

In my PhD research at Utrecht University, I study the musical stories of the eighteenth-century Dutch elite. Comparing the musical practices of nobles and patricians, I aim to find out whether music-making contributed to a shared Dutch elite culture.

Tevens voel ik mij betrokken bij de afstemming van het aanbod op de wensen van de klant. Hiervoor zijn mijn interesse in mensen, mijn inlevingsvermogen en sociale kwaliteiten heel waardevol.

name: Jelske Hoogervorst
skills: ['Band', 'Music', 'Jazz', 'Composition', 'Improvisation', 'Music Theory', 'Saxophone', 'Bands', 'Concerts', 'Sound', 'Soul', 'Drums', 'Music Education', 'Studio Recording', 'Recording', 'Record Labels', 'Small Business Online Marketing', 'Musical Improvisation', 'Music Composition', 'Trainer']
summary:
"One thing I like about jazz, kid, is that I don't know what's going to happen next. Do you?" â€” Bix Beiderbecke

I can teach you how to play the music you imagine. I adopt a very practical approach in teaching you how to improvise. I offer a detailed practice curriculum with clear video examples and great jam tracks. The method I use is called Improvise for Real and is based on a tonal orientation in harmony that helps you understand the sounds in the music around you the way our ear naturally perceives them. Which eventually enables you to play the music you imagine. This applies to all musical styles based on Western harmonies and is studied worldwide by music students of all levels.

Since improvising is the most personal way of expressing yourself, itâ€™s a rule rather than an exception to experience obstacles in your music practice. This is why my personal guidance, during workshops and the 1-on-1 coaching, focuses on overcoming your creative battles to enable you to get to the core of improvising: expressing yourself through the language of music.

My background at a glance:
â€¢ 25 years of teaching experience.
â€¢ International improvisation coach for students worldwide at all levels.

summary:
I have a consulting and educational mindset: I love to help people and organizations where they want to go while being critical and constructive. I deep dive into (new) content eagerly, quickly digging up the essential information and thereby creating overview and structure, which helps in navigating through complex processes. 

I also derive energy from coordinating projects, facilitating processes and developing new ideas in collaboration with internal and external partners. I create and maintain relevant networks. I work with enthusiasm, use a healthy dose of humour (if appropriate), and involve others in solving challenges together. 

Next to my solid knowledge of and experience in sustainable energy technologies, the off-grid energy sector (India) and the energy transition (The Netherlands), I believe we need to focus more on a holistic approach and include a nature-based perspective to work towards a just and healthy earth. 

Therefore, I started absorbing new knowledge and obtaining hands-on experience in the ecosystem restoration sector. My aim is to become more involved in the latter (ecosystem restoration) while including knowledge and experience of the former (sustainable energy).

name: Lys Norbruis
skills: ['Oplossinggericht', 'Dutch', 'Journalism', 'Coaching', 'Teaching', 'Research', 'Social Media', 'Language Teaching', 'Public Relations', 'English', 'Art']
summary:
Verhalen vertellen 
Om mijn honger naar kennis over taal en literatuur te stillen, begon ik in 2007 met de studie Nederlandse taal en cultuur aan de Universiteit Utrecht. Daar ontdekte ik dat ik verhalen wilde vertellen. Of in elk geval wilde leren hoe je nieuws selecteert, analyseert en vervolgens omzet in woord, beeld of geluid. Na mijn opleiding Journalistiek: research en redactie (UvA) richtte ik me op audiovisuele media, maar dat weerhield me er niet van om me ook op het gebied van tekst en communicatie te ontplooien. Bij het Amsterdams Fonds voor de Kunst uitte zich dat o.a. in de ontwikkeling van een social mediastrategie. 

Onderwijs en leiderschap 
Daarna koos ik ervoor om via het traineeship Eerst de Klas kennis te maken met het onderwijs en het bedrijfsleven. Ik volgde de masteropleiding tot docent Nederlands (UU) en ging in het voortgezet onderwijs werken. Ook werkte ik als trainee bij Philips en verzekeraar AON Risk Solutions. Tegelijkertijd startte ik met mijn eigen onderneming: Lys Norbruis - tekst en communicatie. Ik schreef (web)teksten voor scholen en hield me bezig met communicatiestrategie. Ook begon ik met het coachen van onderwijstrainees op het gebied persoonlijke ontwikkeling en leiderschap. Intussen maakte ik de overstap van vo naar hbo. Ik werkte vier jaar lang met ontzettend veel plezier als docent Communicatie in het hbo. Daarna werkte ik op twee NUOVO-scholen: het Leidsche Rijn College en het Utrechts Stedelijk Gymnasium. 

Ideale combinatie
Nu focus ik me niet langer op het schrijven van zakelijke teksten of het lesgeven in het voortgezet onderwijs, maar werk ik met plezier als lerarenopleider Nederlands op de Hogeschool Utrecht. Voor mij is het de ideale combinatie: kennis delen, studenten motiveren en samen met bevlogen collegaâ€™s werken aan beter onderwijs.

name: Niels Martin
summary:
Mijn naam is Niels Timothy Martin (1995) en ik ben geboren en getogen in Zwijndrecht. Ik heb in 2020 even in Rotterdam gewoond en sinds januari 2021 ben ik weer woonachtig in Zwijndrecht.
Na het afronden van het vwo aan het DevelsteinCollege te Zwijndrecht in 2014 ging ik Nederlandse taal en cultuur (BA) studeren aan de Universiteit Leiden. Mijn diploma nam ik in 2017 in ontvangst. Direct na deze bachelor ging ik Neerlandistiek (MA) studeren, aan dezelfde onderwijsinstelling. Deze master rondde ik af in 2018. In februari 2019 begon ik aan de master Lerarenopleiding Nederlands, wederom in Leiden. Deze rondde ik af in februari 2020. Sinds 1 februari 2020 ben ik als docent Nederlandse taal en literatuur werkzaam bij Portus Groene Hart (voorheen Calvijn Groene Hart) te Barendrecht.
Ik ben actief als organist en pianist in verschillende kerken in voornamelijk Zwijndrecht. Ik begeleid de gemeentezang en ondersteun verschillende koren. Af en toe geef ik concerten. Van 2016 tot 2019 volgde ik het vak Practicum Musicae, een vorm van samenwerking tussen de Universiteit Leiden en het Koninklijk Conservatorium in Den Haag. Dit hield in dat ik tijdens mijn universitaire studie ook orgelles kreeg op conservatoriumniveau. Verder componeer en dicht ik.
In mijn geloofsgemeenschap, de Gemeente van Apostolische Christenen (GvAC), werk ik op dit moment aan een nieuw liedboek, ter vervanging van de huidige bundel uit 1997. Daarnaast ben ik priester (scrol naar beneden voor meer informatie hierover (onder 'Ervaring als vrijwilliger' of 'Vrijwilligerswerk')) en ik ben corrector voor 'De Bazuin Sions', het maandblad van de GvAC.
Verder heb ik tekstedities van vroegmoderne toneelstukken gemaakt voor de Leidse database Ceneton en ik houd mij bezig met stamboomonderzoek.

name: Lynn de Rijk
summary:
My research focuses on language in real-world interaction in a wide range of settings. I am interested in how language is used as a social tool among other tools, such as non-verbal signals. Currently, I am working on human-robot interaction as part of my PhD project, and I also work on interaction between pigs that are reared for meat production.

My PhD project explores the way humans attribute meaning to non-verbal conduct. To investigate this, I look at interaction between humans and a robot they are 'meeting' for the first time, using a Conversation Analytic approach. Understanding when behavior gets treated like it has communicative meaning, i.e., when behavior becomes a signal, will add to linguistic theory on human communication.

summary:
Ik heb het grote geluk dat ik twee droombanen heb gevonden! 

Door de week werk ik in de boekhandel waar ik verantwoordelijk ben voor alles wat met kinderboeken te maken heeft en voor de organisatie van evenementen, zoals schrijversbezoeken, lezingen en signeersessies. Heb je vragen over kinderboeken of over het boeken van een evenement in de boekhandel? Neem dan gerust contact met me op! 

Al twintig jaar lang dans ik vol enthousiasme bij balletschool Wanda Kuiper en sinds december word ik daar intern opgeleid tot balletjuf voor kinderen vanaf 7 jaar: een nieuwe stap waar ik ongelofelijk blij mee ben!

summary:
Ambitie
Mijn ambitie is een actieve en persoonlijke bijdrage leveren aan een duurzame samenleving.

Rode draad loopbaan
In mijn loopbaan staan mens, arbeid, organisatie en maatschappij centraal.

Persoonlijke omschrijving
Ik zou me zelf het beste kunnen omschrijven als een â€˜mensenmensâ€™, â€˜organisatiemanâ€™ en â€˜People Managerâ€™.

Visie op organisatieadvies
Ieder mens en iedere organisatie is uniek. Iedere arbeidsorganisatie wordt gekenmerkt door haar eigen ontstaansgeschiedenis, toekomstbeeld, dynamiek en complexiteit, taal, gewoonten, vorm en omgeving. Organisaties van mensen zijn lerende en levende organismen met een eigen uniciteit.

In mijn optiek bestaan er geen generieke of standaard oplossingen en keukenrecepten voor de uitdagingen waar organisaties en de mensen die daarin werkzaam zijn voor staan. Deze vragen om verdieping, tijd, betrokkenheid en maatwerk.

Passie
Mijn passie ligt in de relatie tussen mens, arbeid, organisatie en maatschappij, in de dynamische en complexe context waarin mensen en organisaties hun doelen nastreven, en hierin met raad en daad mijn persoonlijke bijdrage leveren.

Inmiddels heb ik 25 jaar ervaring in diverse advies- en managementfuncties in de publieke sector. 
Een passie voor politiek en bestuur, een hart voor onderwijs en een grote interesse in communicatie vormen de rode draden van deze loopbaan.

Reizen en schrijven zijn twee andere persoonlijke passies. Dat is de reden dat ik daarnaast ook werkzaam ben als freelance schrijver en journalist. Sinds begin 2019 ben ik tevens eigenaar van Uitgeverij Passionate Nomads.

Begin 2020 publiceerde ik â€˜Het verdriet van Griekenlandâ€™, een journalistieke beschouwing van de politieke en maatschappelijke situatie van hedendaags Griekenland en meer specifiek de Griekse crisis. ðŸ”¹ My current job
 I coordinate daily operations and order fulfillment and handle communication, both internally and externally. As the main point of contact, I need to provide extensive customer support, building lasting business relationships.

ðŸ”¹ My education
I graduated in 2016 from Utrecht University, where I got my Bachelors in Pedagogical Sciences.  During my studies I did a minor in (dis)ability management and obtained great knowledge on social and behavioral theories, challenging psychosocial development and cultural diversity. More generally I learned to be critical, enhanced my analytic skills and overall competence as a young professional.

ðŸ”¹ My experience
Over the years I have worked in all kind of customer service jobs, in supermarkets, to Horeca establishments and corporations. I did an internship as a behavioral scientist, worked as a study and guidance counselor and I volunteered as an activity guide for children with disabilities for years. 
I did a lot of coaching in these jobs, for which I followed several courses. 
During an advanced study course, for example, I learned different coaching techniques which we had to practice in weekly one-hour coaching sessions. We had to give a 3-hour group training and do a life coaching session in front of the trainers. I actually excelled at this course and was asked to become a trainer for the next year. In between jobs, I did some freelance work, correcting and revising texts.

summary:
Data Scientist with a technical background, but a love for pragmatics. I like to apply complex state-of-the-art techniques, but I ensure that the simple solution is not overlooked, which might give the same or better results. That is what counts for me: the result.

In my work, I put much consideration in the social aspects of data. On the surface, data might look objective and the analysis thereof seems pure mathematics. However, as people are the topic of the data most of the time, there is more psychology in data than you might think. The story behind the data becomes clearer when taking this into account. 

Finally, I like being involved with data ethics, for example GDPR or how to apply responsible AI. This way, I combine my background in econometrics, psychology and philosophy in my work as Data Scientist.

summary:
I am an economist and a behavioural scientist. I am currently the Director of the Consumer Protection Research Initiative at Innovations for Poverty Action. The initiative tries to identify, diagnose and solve consumer protection risks in digital finance through new methods of data analysis and rigorous testing of solutions through impact evaluations. By working with regulators, financial service providers, and civil society, we are building solutions that will ensure consumers are well-protected from new risks that emerge alongside financial innovations. 

I have 16 years of applied economics experience working with governments, regulators, not-for-profit and commercial companies, using research to understand and solve problems. Although I've never been a formal academic, I try to keep well connected to academia. I am a Visiting Senior Fellow at the London School of Economics Department for Psychology and Behavioural Science. My work has been published in top finance, economics and marketing journals, presented at Harvard, MIT, Chicago Booth and LSE, and featured in The Financial Times, The Wall Street Journal, The Economist and The Chicago Booth Review.

skills: ['Teamwork', 'Project Planning', 'Pharmacoepidemiology', 'Pharmaceutical Industry', 'Outcomes Research', 'Meta-analysis', 'Sistematic Review', 'Pharmacoeconomics', 'Pharmacovigilance', 'Risk Management', 'Health Economics', 'HEOR', 'Oncology']
summary:
For more information visit my website
https://sites.google.com/view/franciscavargaslopes

Francisca Vargas Lopes is a Ph.D. Candidate at the Department of Public Health of the Erasmus Medical Center, in Rotterdam, having joint supervision from the Erasmus School of Economics. Her project is focused in conducting impact evaluation of health policies, specifically evaluating the effect in health and health care inequalities. She is studying the areas of mental health care, long-term care, health insurance coverage and cost-sharing.  

Francisca graduated as a Pharmacist (M.Pharm) from the Faculty of Pharmacy of the University of Lisbon in 2013. In 2017, she completed an MSc in International Health Policy and Health Economics at the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), in the UK. While in London Francisca has been a research assistant to Social Policy and Psychological and Behavioural Science departments at LSE and has had academic placements at the health care focused think-thank Nuffield Trust and at the Health Value for Money team of the National Audit Office.

As part of her working experience Francisca has performed the roles of Outcomes Consultant and Outcomes Research Manager, respectively in UK and Portuguese subsidiaries of multinational pharmaceutical industries. summary:
Research, education and music: that is who I am. 

Critical thinking enthuses me, asking again and again: 'why'? I love social-scientific research, seeking for reliable and valid methods to increase our knowledge about the world. In this research, the perspective of those who are often not heard, who remain marginalized, is for me essential. In my own research, I have researched topics related to the securitization of migration, discrimination among higher educated migrants ('the discrimination paradox') and inequities in the global distribution of resources to combat COVID-19.

Education always gives me energy. To inspire students about various subjects, ranging from politics and social issues to music history, is one of the most amazing things to me. For me, the connection between teacher and student is always essential - to learn from each other.

Music also plays a central role in my life. Music can surprise, shock and leave you in awe. I feel driven to convey my passion for classical music to a young and old audience through lectures at the foundation 'Oud Geleerd, Jong Gedaan' and the young early music choir Ensemble Illustre.

summary:
Hi there! Let me introduce myself. I have a Master's degree in International Relations and I am currently living in the Netherlands. 

After high school, I decided to enroll in the Faculty of Political Science at La Sapienza (the university of Rome), as I was attracted by the multidisciplinary nature of the course Political Sciences and International Relations. This course taught me the fundamentals of law, (political) economy, sociology and philosophy and also formed me as a person by supplying me with all the necessary tools to understand todayâ€™s society, looking at it from different points of view. During the last year of my bachelorâ€™s course, I was able to expand the specific skills that I already acquired in the international field. Exams such as International and European Law, Comparative Constitutional Law, Political Economy and the study of languages have fueled my desire to become an expert in the field of International Relations. For this reason, I decided to continue my studies at La Sapienza. In 2020, I obtained a Masterâ€™s degree in International Relations with honours. 

My greatest passion is to travel and get in touch with different cultures. During the Masterâ€™s course, I had the privilege to cultivate this passion: In 2018 I won a scholarship to study six months at the University of Applied Sciences of Amsterdam. During the minor International and European Trade Law, I learned how to solve complex legal cases and conduct legal advisory discussions. Thanks to the numerous presentations and the drafting of pleas and advisory opinions I improved my knowledge of the English language and further developed my (oral and written) communication skills. In specific, the course negotiation skills taught me how to evade conflicts in tense circumstances and to effectively communicate in a business context. Moreover, in 2019, I was selected by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to carry out an internship at the Italian Cultural Institute in Mexico City. This internship was a marvelous experience and a journey of personal and professional growth. I learned to work in a team, I honed my organisational and planning skills in order to meet the numerous deadlines and I found myself able to work well under pressure with little supervision.

After working as a Digital Marketing Specialist for Accenture, I am now working for Rabobank as a KYC Associate. 

Email address:
ilaria.capparella94@gmail.com

summary:
As a young professional with a passion for Climate Resilience and Risk Management, I am looking for new opportunities to develop solutions to climate disasters on a global scale. Currently, I am completing my Master's in Public Policy and Human Development with a Specialization in Risk and Vulnerability at UNU-Merit. This double degree program has equipped me for a career path in Risk Management, both through knowledge on Disaster Management in the developing and developed worlds, as well as through a comprehensive quantitative track on Data Analytics and Spatial/Geographic Mapping and Analysis. In addition, I am deepening my skillset through my intern position with the UNU-Climate Resilience Initiative, in the framework of which I investigate the July 2021 floods in Germany, Belgium and Netherlands with an interdisciplinary  team of researchers from different universities. 

My interest and motivation for the sphere of Climate Resilience has developed early on, throughout my Bachelor's in European Studies at Maastricht University. As a Delegate to Model United Nations Conferences, I have discovered my talent and joy of public speaking and political negotiation in international environments. Throughout the Covid-related lockdown, I was also active as a Team Leader at the European Careers Association Maastricht, oranizing and coordinating joint learning sessions with groups of students with whom I explored  EU history, economics and politics. 

In the future I strive to continue in the field of Climate Resilience and Risk Management. I believe that we can deal with the challenges presented to us by climate change if we work together and out of the box.
