name: Tomas Cirhan, Ph.D.
skills: ['Research', 'Teaching', 'Political Science', 'European Union Politics', 'Social Sciences', 'Quantitative Research', 'Qualitative Research', 'Currency Exchange', 'Management', 'Sales', 'Politics', 'Czech politics', 'postcommunist politics & society', 'Teamwork', 'Presentation Skills', 'Recruiting', 'English', 'Czech']
summary:
I am currently at the beginning of my academic career. I hold a researcher position at two universities - Leiden University in Leiden, the Netherlands, and Charles University in Prague, the Czech Republic. I have recently completed PhD in Political Sciences at Leiden University. I am focusing predominately on the new parties of political entrepreneurs and their party organization.
My previous research dealt with new anti-establishment parties, post-communist party systems and rise of populist politics in central-eastern Europe. I have focused on the role of party organization in the electoral success of new anti-establishment parties. To achieve this research objective, firstly, a single case study took place, analysing three party organizational aspects (local party organization, party membership and the party elite). Secondly, a comparative analysis with three other parties in three different European countries was conducted. This research project was conducted under the supervision of Professor Dr Petr Kopecky and Dr Maria Spirova.
I have acquired my master's degree in Globalization (politics and sociology) from the University of Aberdeen, the United Kingdom, where I have graduated with commendation in November 2013. My master's research was a comparative study of differences in integration between Czech and Polish migrants in the United Kingdom, supervised by Dr Christopher Kollmeyer. 
I have finished my undergraduate studies at Robert Gordon University, the United Kingdom, receiving a bachelor of arts degree with honours from Applied Social Sciences. I have devoted my bachelor's research to the study of standardization in workplaces and the application of McDonaldization theory, I was supervised by Dr Donncha Marron.

name: Tjeerd De Graaf
skills: ['Linguistics', 'Lecturing', 'Teaching', 'Research', 'Higher Education', 'History', 'Phonetics', 'Ethnolinguistics', 'Physics', 'Academic Writing', 'Multilingual', 'Translation', 'Russian', 'Theory', 'Qualitative Research', 'Dutch', 'Editing', 'European Union', 'Science', 'Social Sciences']
summary:
Since 1990 Tjeerd de Graaf, has specialized in the phonetic aspects of ethnolinguistics. In that year he made his first fieldwork trip with a Japanese expedition to the minority peoples of Sakhalin. Since then he has contributed to various research projects with colleagues in the Russian Federation and Japan. Most of these projects were financially supported by special grants from the European Union and the Netherlands Organization of Scientific Research NWO. In 1998 he received a Doctorate Honoris Causa for this work from the University of St.Petersburg. Since 2002 he is a board member of the Foundation for Endangered Languages (Great Britain) and a research fellow at the Fryske Akademy, which co-ordinates research on the language, history and culture of Frisian, one of the lesser used languages of Europe. As a team member of the Mercator European Research Centre on Multilingualism and Language Learning he contributes to the work related to minorities in the European Union. In the first half of 2003 he spent a semester as visiting professor at the University of St.Petersburg and in 2004 and 2005 he worked as guest researcher at the Slavic Research Center of Hokkaido University (Japan).

name: Elisabeth Opsahl
skills: ['English', 'Music', 'Classical', 'Coaching', 'Teaching', 'Early Music', 'Dutch', 'Chamber Music']
summary:
Elisabeth Opsahl studied RECORDER at the Norwegian State Academy of Music (Oslo, Norway) and at the Royal Conservatory of the Hague and the Hogeschool voor de Kunsten Utrecht in the Netherlands. Her teachers were, amongst others, R-M Verhagen and H ter Schegget. She specialized in music from the baroque era, but she also worked with contemporary music, often in cooperation with composers.

She studied CORNETTO at the Conservatoire de Musique de Geneve (Geneve, Switserland) and at the Schola Cantorum Basiliensis (Basel, Switserland). Her teachers were William Dongois and Bruce Dickey. During her cornetto studies, she focused on the styles and historical performance practice of music from the 16th and 17th century, with improvisation as a main field.

She performed with various ensembles in the Netherlands, Belgium and Norway (a.o. Brabants Musyccollegium, Il Concerto Barocco, Holland Opera, Oslo Baroque Orchestra, Barokkanerne).
She also gave concerts in the United States, Israel, Finland and Australia, with orchestras as the Finnish Baroque Orchestra and Jerusalem BaroqueOrchestra.

Elisabeth works regularly with project orchestras and smaller chamber music ensembles. She is a member of the ensembles â€œBreeze recorder consortâ€,  â€œthe Delta Consortâ€ (woodwind and brass, strings and continuo instruments) and â€Ensemble Noorderlichtâ€ (an ensemble that mainly works with Scandinavian music).

Elisabeth also participated in music theater productions. She has written and arranged scripts and music for performances.

Elisabeth conducts the Nordic Choir Rotterdam and Grov Skole- og amatÃ¸rkorps.
She gives lectures and workshops about various aspects of music and culture.

In addition to her musical work, Elisabeth owns and runs the Scandinavian language school â€ScandiTaal â€“ Centrum voor Scandinavische Talen en Cultuurâ€ and â€œLinguanor - Norwegian language courseâ€. The schools offerlanguage courses on a high level to companies, groups and individuals.

Elisabeth lives partly in The Hague, Netherlands and in Grovfjord, Norway.

name: Noortje van Amsterdam
skills: ['Qualitative Research', 'Sociology', 'Anthropology', 'Ethnography', 'Social Research', 'Research', 'Teaching', 'Gender', 'Lecturing', 'Social Sciences', 'Political Science', 'Cultural Anthropology', 'Report Writing', 'Politics', 'Theory', 'SPSS', 'Quantitative Research']
summary:
Noortje van Amsterdam is assistant professor Organization Studies at Utrecht School of Governance. Her research focusses on the social constructions and performances of bodies and health. Informed by feminist poststructuralism, intersectionality, postcolonial theories and new materialism, she aims to explore the ideological power structures and material circumstances that shape inequalities based on embodied signifiers such as gender, dis/ability, age, sexuality and race/ethnicity. In her research, she combines conventional qualitative methodologies with Arts-Based Research (e.g. poetic inquiry, visual methods, autoethnographic writing) to shed light on the everyday experiences of people with (their) bodies and health and to inspire critical reflexivity and empathic understanding. On the website she has created with Dide van Eck - www.poetryatwork.me - you can find some of her research poetry.

Noortje has explored the constructions and performances of bodies and health in different settings such as professional organizations, academia, physical education, and dance. Themes she addresses in her research include: fatness, dis/ability, motherhood, menopause, diversity in education, and young people's identities. The interdisciplinary nature of her research brings together organization studies, gender studies, health sociology, education, disability studies, fat studies and sport sociology.

Keywords:  embodiment, diversity, health, gender, age, disability, fatness, discourse, qualitative research, arts-based methodologies.

summary:
In recent years my research has focussed on intermedial representations of the subarctic and polar areas. I am a tenured Assistant professor at Amsterdam university, and I am also a member of the Concurrences LNUC research group in Sweden, where I was named Associate professor in 2013. Due to my research on Linnaeus, I was elected Fellow of the Linnean Society, FLS. In Amsterdam, I continue to be a member of the European Travel Cluster, of the Digitial Emotions Group and of the Translation studies Group and am a member of the VOSSIUS institute for the history of science. I served as a Board member of the IRSCL from 2011-2015 and of the APECS council 2013-2016, and am a member of HASSEG and PEI. Also, I have published and co-edited several volumes on ChildrenÂ´s literature, postcolonial studies and on Astrid Lindgren. I am a member of several editorial boards and co-editor of a bookseries at Winter.
After finishing my PhD in Scandinavian Studies and English literature, I worked first as a lecturer in GÃ¶ttingen, participating in several larger research projects on translation studies and international relations. Then I moved on to the Scandinavian department at the University of Cologne as an Assistant professor and then further to the Scandinavian department at Amsterdam University as an Assistant professor where I received tenure after two years. During five years, I was first Astrid Lindgren Memorial professor and later Visiting professor at Linnaeus University in Comparative literature and Literary studies.

***ENGLISH***

Quantitative sociologist with an interdisciplinary background and six years of research experience as a doctoral researcher at the Catholic University of Leuven. Proven ability to carry out theory-driven empirical research from beginning to end, resulting in publications in peer-reviewed international scientific journals and books. Experienced and skilled in analyzing cross-sectional, cross-national and longitudinal survey data with SPSS and Excel, and in describing and visualizing the findings in clear and understandable language and figures.

summary:
As a recent graduate with a master's degree in Tourism, Culture, and Society from Erasmus University in Rotterdam, I bring a unique interdisciplinary perspective to the table. My program combined research from various academic disciplines, including sociology, cultural economics, anthropology, heritage studies, and media studies. For my thesis, I explored the influence of social media on destination image creation, utilizing digital ethnography to examine consumer behavior.
   Furthermore, my bachelor's degree in Cultural Anthropology equips me with a strong foundation in qualitative data gathering and problem-solving, allowing me to analyze subjects from both macro and micro perspectives. This is exemplified by my two months of fieldwork in New Orleans, USA, where I investigated the impact of tourism on the traditional celebration of Mardi Gras.
  My passion lies in exploring the evolving landscape of tourism, which is influenced by the latest technologies as well as environmental challenges. I am excited to share my distinctive viewpoint and make valuable contributions to the field.

summary:
The last fifteen years of my career I have combined teaching in the Netherlands and abroad (Universities of SanaÃ¡, Venice and Chicaco) with management positions, the latter always being concerned with academic education. I have published extensively on this topic (in both academic and popular journals) and I feel it is a privilege to be able to provide young people with the knowledge and skills necessary for living and working successfully in a highly complex world. To this I have dedicated my career.

In 2006, when I was appointed as program director for the BA and MA in Sociology at the Tilburg University faculty of social sciences, I was invited to design, in collaboration with colleagues from other faculties, an educational Liberal Arts and Sciences program. After the accreditation of the program in 2007, I was appointed Vice-Dean of the LAS program. In January of 2012 I became Dean of LAS and in 2013 was appointed as Educational Professor at Tilburg University, the designation indicating that it is a professorship not involving research. 

I am currently Dean of the Liberal Arts and Sciences (LAS) Bachelorâ€™s program at Tilburg University. As such I bear final responsibility for the educational policy of Liberal Arts and Sciences in Tilburg and its implementation in the program. Under my leadership the LAS program in Tilburg has flourished: the program scores high in national rankings (having been officially recognized as a top-rated program since 2014), our student inflow has been rising steadily, and our graduates are not only admitted to prestigious (research) Masterâ€™s programs both in the Netherlands and abroad, they are also very successful in them. I am proud to say that our students are very enthusiastic, that the courses in the program get excellent evaluations, and not least of all that the quality of the teachers is rated as outstanding.

See: https://www.tilburguniversity.edu/webwijs/show/a.vlenning-1.htm for a full list of publications.

summary:
Right now, I am working at Legal Intelligence as a data scientist. In my team we try to use advanced data techniques to develop the newest legal tech for our customers (legal professionals). Next to a searchable library that needs to be optimised, we also try to use data science to create new connections between documents. This helps our customers get the information they need faster. 

I have always liked to use data science in fields that I did not know much about beforehand. Before working at Legal Intelligence I have worked at ABN Amro as a data analyst for (sustainable) investment products. Next to that I gained experience at the province of North-Holland by modelling traffic light controllers and their delay. I have also worked at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam as a data scientist to analyse student performance in different environments. 

In my Master Data Science I have learned a lot about programming, machine learning and the optimal usage of data-analysis. I loved studying something technical after a long 'career' in social sciences. 

I finished two bachelors: Sociology and Political Science. During my Bachelor in Sociology, I have gained extensive experience with SPSS, including necessary skills such as multiple regression and factor analysis. In my thesis, I created a scaling of dutch occupations based on their social-economic status. I used a multitrait-multimethod analysis to validate the constructed scale.Â 

Because of my bachelor in political science, I can easily spot societal and political challenges and see what ethical and legal aspects these challenges bring. It also taught me how social and ethical dimensions construct narratives, arguments and opinions. In that finding lies a possibly more important lesson of seeing how the opinions of other people are founded. It enables me to look beyond my own opinion.

At the University Utrecht I have learned to conduct quantitative research and to form policies. My research and analytical skills were developed during my bachelor's program. The aspects of sociology that interested me the most were the connection with society, conducting research both in a quantitative and a qualitative way and thinking about society from a philosophical perspective. 

Next to my studies, I have always had a parttime job in the hospitality industry. I really enjoyed the social aspects of this job, such as facilitating a great night out for guests and working together as a team with my colleagues. Working in the hospitality industry has taught me many skills as working efficiently and fast, solving problems and managing stressful situations.

The opportunity to keep on developing myself in various fields of interest is important to me. I have a scientific background and I am always looking for ways to improve my analytical and research skills.

summary:
Letizia Chiappini holds a PhD in sociology and urban studies, (UrbEur Doctorate) at the Department of Sociology and Social Research, University of Milano-Bicocca and at the University of Amsterdam (joint doctorate). Her research interests revolve around urban transformations and the generation of societal change under contemporary capitalism. This is reflected in her ongoing PhD project in which she attends critically to the development of sharing economy policies at the urban level. She employs a comparative perspective based on extensive fieldwork in Milan and Amsterdam. She is currently a lecturer at the University of Applied Sciences in Utrecht. She works on urban digital platforms and is the co-founder of the collective Slutty Urbanism which has been part of the Architecture Venice Biennale in 2021 within the Austrian Pavilion. Recently, she is involved as a guest professor at the TU-Wien in the course â€˜Visual Art and the Cityâ€.

In other ongoing projects, she investigates the maker movement, crafting, digital fabrication and making more broadly (e.g. FabLabs) as an alternative mode and space of production, starting from initial empirical engagement in Milan. These projects are undertaken in collaboration with researchers across UniversitÃ  di Milano-Bicocca, Politecnico di Milano and UniversitÃ  degli Studi di Milano.

Research for her master's thesis focused on smart city discourse and participatory processes in urban governance. She holds a bachelor's degree in literature and philosophy (University of Parma), and a master's degree in sociology and social research (the University of Milano-Bicocca, co-supervised with Aalborg University, Denmark).

After obtaining both a research master's and clinical master's degree in developmental psychology, I've obtained my PhD degree (Cum Laude) at the department of Sociology (Interuniversity Center for Social Science Theory and Methodology; ICS), University of Groningen. 

I primarily focus on persistent victimization of bullying and specifically bias-based bullying, and how its predictors and consequences interact with social context on multiple levels. My papers are at the intersection of sociology (influence processes, group norms) psychology (developmental trajectories), pedagogy (role of teacher and school characteristics), and prevention sciences (interventions).


Mijn onderzoek richt zich op (chronische) slachtoffers van pesten, en de rol van de thuis-, school-, en individuele context daarbij. Ik geef ook met plezier lezingen of workshops voor scholen, ouders of organisaties die zich bezighouden met pesten onder kinderen/jongeren.

name: Jora Broerse, PhD
skills: ['Kwalitatief onderzoek', 'Research', 'English', 'Teaching', 'Public Speaking', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Microsoft Word', 'PowerPoint', 'Windows', 'Strategic Planning', 'Management', 'Coaching', 'Qualitative Research', 'Dutch', 'Program Evaluation']
summary:
I am a researcher in the Sport Management Research Group in the Centre of Expertise Urban Vitality  and lecturer at Sport Studies, both at the Faculty of Sports and Nutrition, Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences. 

I am also a Research Fellow in Public Health at Mitchell Institute for Education and Health Policy, Victoria University. The Mitchell Institute is one of the country's leading education and health policy think tanks. The Institute is home to the Australian Health Policy Collaboration (AHPC) and works to inform and influence public policy and practice to improve the health opportunities for all Australians, in particular those in socio-economically disadvantaged communities. As a Research Fellow I focus on supporting health policy recommendations on the prevention and management of chronic diseases and risk factors for those diseases with international and evidence-based research. I have led the AHPC projects 'Australia's Health Tracker by Socioeconomic Status 2021', the 'Getting Australia's Health on Track 2021' and 'Enhancing the role of Health and Physical Education in Public Health'. 

In November 2021, I completed my PhD in the Sociology of Sport/Sport Management at the Institute for Health and Sport, Victoria University. I am specialised in qualitative research methods working both in a research team and independently. My research interests include community sport, ethnic diversity, social inclusion, everyday multiculturalism, and sport-for-development programs. My research has been translated into recommendation reports for the public sector (e.g., Western Bulldogs Community Foundation) and peer-reviewed publications. I have presented my work at various national and international conferences. 

Research Gate: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Jora_Broerse
ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4954-4802
The Conversation: https://theconversation.com/profiles/jora-broerse-1278240/articles

name: Tomas Cirhan, Ph.D.
skills: ['Research', 'Teaching', 'Political Science', 'European Union Politics', 'Social Sciences', 'Quantitative Research', 'Qualitative Research', 'Currency Exchange', 'Management', 'Sales', 'Politics', 'Czech politics', 'postcommunist politics & society', 'Teamwork', 'Presentation Skills', 'Recruiting', 'English', 'Czech']
summary:
I am currently at the beginning of my academic career. I hold a researcher position at two universities - Leiden University in Leiden, the Netherlands, and Charles University in Prague, the Czech Republic. I have recently completed PhD in Political Sciences at Leiden University. I am focusing predominately on the new parties of political entrepreneurs and their party organization.
My previous research dealt with new anti-establishment parties, post-communist party systems and rise of populist politics in central-eastern Europe. I have focused on the role of party organization in the electoral success of new anti-establishment parties. To achieve this research objective, firstly, a single case study took place, analysing three party organizational aspects (local party organization, party membership and the party elite). Secondly, a comparative analysis with three other parties in three different European countries was conducted. This research project was conducted under the supervision of Professor Dr Petr Kopecky and Dr Maria Spirova.
I have acquired my master's degree in Globalization (politics and sociology) from the University of Aberdeen, the United Kingdom, where I have graduated with commendation in November 2013. My master's research was a comparative study of differences in integration between Czech and Polish migrants in the United Kingdom, supervised by Dr Christopher Kollmeyer. 
I have finished my undergraduate studies at Robert Gordon University, the United Kingdom, receiving a bachelor of arts degree with honours from Applied Social Sciences. I have devoted my bachelor's research to the study of standardization in workplaces and the application of McDonaldization theory, I was supervised by Dr Donncha Marron.

name: Bernard Kleikamp
field of studies 1: Asian Studies, specialisation Tibetan and Buddhism
skills: ['Sound recording, sound editing, sound restoration, music publishing', 'Concert promotor, artist manager, concert production advice', 'Ethnic music specialist, Tibetologist', 'Music Production', 'Music Industry', 'Recording', 'Festivals', 'Music Education', 'Editing', 'Performing Arts', 'Classical', 'Research', 'Teaching']
summary:
Bernard Kleikamp has been a key person in the folkrevival of The Netherlands since the mid-1970s. He is an ethnomusicologist/businessman, who studied drama, ethnomusicology, and language and literature of The Netherlands, at the University of Amsterdam in the 1970s. He has organised the Leiden Folkfestival for 16 years (1975-1990), and was one of the founders of the Dutch folkmagazine Janviool, later called New Folksounds (1977), for which he wrote reviews and interviews. He was director of music festivals â€˜Brass Worldwideâ€™ and â€˜Festmedâ€™ in the 1990s. His interest in musical traditions resulted in a life-long quest to the origins and roots of music, of which almost every footstep has been documented by an LP, CD or DVD (so far the count stops at around 350). He is president/owner of Pan Records since the mid-1980s and has run Paradox Concerts (a concert agency for ethnic music) from 1978 until 2003, organising an estimated 500 concert tours in that period. In 1997 he graduated as a music publisher. Between 1990 and today he did ethnomusicological fieldwork in Hungary, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Netherlands, Russia (Khakassia, Yeletz and Saratov regions), Azerbaijjan, China (Tibet, Guizhou, and Yunnan Provinces), Nepal, Marocco, England, USA, Lithuania, Sicily.
Since 2005 he specializes in sound restoration, for which he had his collection of reel-to-reel tape-recorders (dating from the 1950s to the 1980s) revised and restored.
A couple of years after the 2008 crisis in the music industry, he went back to university, and got his Master's degree in Asian Studies with specialisations Tibet and Buddhism in 2020. His scholarly papers can be found at academia.edu, while his blog is found at pansdelight.blogspot.com

name: monique masius
skills: ['creativity', 'Creative Problem Solving', 'Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction', 'Movement Therapy', 'Reliability', 'empath', 'Student Counseling', 'Project Coordination', 'Organization Skills', 'Event Planning', 'Coaching', 'Sports Training', 'Zumbatraining', 'Fitnesstraining', 'dance coaching', 'Salsationtraining', 'Latin Dance', 'Personal Development', 'Motivationstraining', 'Teaching']
summary:
My career has been versatile but in all industries I was considered to be a 'person of trust'. I have listened to people who were sharing their problems, fears, frustrations etc., helping them to find a solution or professional guidance. Theater and Dance have played an important part of my professional and private life. The auditorium and stage have been the places I felt the happiest in, but at the same time people who took up these spaces also created feelings of anxiety, frustration, anger and fear for many colleagues I have worked with. Leaving this unhealthy environment behind, was the most difficult decision ever, but I have never regretted it.  I feel that 'from the outside, looking in' I can be of more help. I have always wondered why the industry who works with and displays emotions has never employed psychologists, therapists or at least a counsellar to ensure a safe, healthy professional environment.  

Today, the moment has arrived that everyone agrees that these services should be offered at last and I am so happy to become a part of the solutions to the problems I have so often witnessed. I offer counselling sessions and workshops in which physical theater and movement therapy help theater and dance professionals feel and perform better, stronger and more confident in their workplaces.

name: Eva van der Weerd
skills: ['WordPress', 'Engels', 'Creatief schrijven', 'Theater', 'Kunstkritiek']
summary:
Ik heb mijn BA Theaterwetenschap afgerond aan de UvA en University of Exeter (UK) en ben op dit moment bezig met mijn MA Contemporary Theatre, Dance and Dramaturgy aan de Universiteit Utrecht. Mijn passie ligt in het theaterveld, ik zie mezelf daarin werkzaam als recensent en toneelschrijver en doe hier naast mijn studie zoveel mogelijk ervaring in op, bijvoorbeeld bij Theaterkrant. Daarnaast ben ik me aan het oriÃ«nteren in dramaturgie en theaterprogrammering. 

Bij Het Nationale Theater hou ik me bezig met toegankelijkheid van theater voor mensen met een beperking. Daarbij focus ik me op het delen van onze kennis met de rest van de culturele sector, zodat deze in zijn geheel toegankelijker wordt voor iedereen.

Ik hou me ook graag bezig met de (online) archivering van theater. Vanuit de Podiumkunstencollectie van het Allard Pierson Museum hou ik alle premiÃ¨res in Nederland (van zowel Nederlandse als buitenlandse producenten) bij in de grote database van het theaterarchief van de Podiumkunstencollectie van de UvA (voorheen van het TIN). Deze database is een hoofdbron van de Theaterencyclopedie. Het werk roept veel vragen op over wat wel en niet te archiveren en onder welke labels.

Ik schrijf graag bewerkingen en vertalingen van bestaande stukken/boeken/films voor toneel en musical en ben altijd op zoek naar mogelijkheden om hier meer werk van te maken. Tips?

summary:
Impact maken voor een betere & gelukkige wereld en het inspireren, verbinden en bewustmaken van mensen. Dat is mijn ambitie! Het liefste draag ik bij aan duurzame, culturele en maatschappelijke ontwikkeling en werk ik vanuit gemeenschappelijke doelen en waarden: merken die het waard zijn om gezien te worden, maak ik zichtbaar en voelbaar. En dat mag ik vanaf 1 november gaan doen bij het Frans Hals Museum! 

BELEVING & VERBINDING
Verbinding is mijn codewoord. Ik geloof sterk in de kracht van goede concepten en intermenselijke relaties. Klopt het in de kern, dan kunnen alle bruggen tussen kunst en commercie of tussen mens en organisatie, product of issue geslagen worden zodat mensen echt betrokken raken en blijven. 

Belangrijk voor mij is om altijd te blijven leren en bezig te zijn met: creativiteit, beleving, verhalen vertellen, analyseren & onderzoeken, luisteren, strategie & advies, verbinden en actie!


BIO
Na het afstuderen voor mijn HBO opleiding Media & Entertainment Management en voor de bachelor Theaterwetenschap aan de UVA ben ik full time aan de slag gegaan bij Alterego, waar ik al tijdens mijn eerdere stage een passie ontwikkelde voor marketing, food & drinks. Vervolgens heb ik bij duurzaam communicatiebureau Heldergroen het brandmanagement opgestart en gebouwd aan de zichtbaarheid en het netwerk van de positieve groene beweging. Daarnaast heb ik een sterke voorliefde voor theater, film, kunst, conceptontwikkeling, onderzoek, strategie, campagne management, organisatie en (online- en content) marketing. Sinds enige tijd ben ik betrokken bij het Domein voor Kunstkritiek als bestuurslid en voorzie ik deze organisatie vanuit die rol van marketing- en communicatie advies. 

Eigenschappen:
ambitieus, enthousiast, kan mensen motiveren, doorzetter, nieuwsgierig, analytisch, gevoelig, betrouwbaar, creatief en overtuigd in alles wat ik onderneem.

summary:
Verbinden. Bouwen aan vertrouwen. Luisteren en alle perspectieven zien. 
Als klankbord voor teams, collega's, leidinggevenden  en directie adviseer en coach ik in communicatie en samenwerken bij veranderingen. Adviseren, coachen en trainen van ieders communicatieve rol. 
Bij veranderen, teamontwikkeling en continu verbeteren is goede communicatie onmisbaar, want met ruis op de lijn kom je nu eenmaal lastig voorwaarts. Samen bouwen aan vertrouwen met begrijpelijke en aansprekende informatie, aan communicatiemiddelen met bereik en impact. En tegelijk bouwen aan leiderschap, bestuurlijke en lijncommunicatie. 

Keuzes maken, lef hebben en volhouden. Feiten delen en in gesprek. 
Mensen informeren, motiveren en inspireren, maar ook luisteren, verrast worden en leren van de dialoog. Leukste vraag: "Hoe krijg ik ze mee?"  Interne betrokkenheid: de mooiste de basis voor samenwerking en externe communicatie. Leuk dus om te bouwen aan berichtgeving, trots, imago en reputatiemanagement. Veel ervaring ook in de externe communicatie met positioneren en profileren van opleidingen en onderzoek in een omgeving waar onderscheidend vermogen hoog nodig is. Van inside out naar outside in. Of het nu om interne communicatie gaat, teamcoaching, teamontwikkeling, bestuurlijke of verandercommunicatie, gedragsbeÃ¯nvloeding, reputatie of positionering: het spanningsveld van verschillende belangen hoort erbij. Keuzes maken geeft duidelijkheid. Eervolle uitdaging aan de organisatie, aan teams en ieders communicatie. 

Informatie leuk en klein maken brengt mensen in beweging. 
Of zoals Albert Einstein zei: 'Logica brengt je van A naar B. Verbeelding brengt je overal.' Waarom zouden we alleen het analytische denken van de linkerhersenhelft benutten als we ook een creatief, snel en conceptueel denkende rechterhersenhelft ter beschikking hebben?  Maak het van A naar B Ã³Ã³k leuk en simpel. #krachtvanbeeld

name: Inti Soeterik
skills: ['Qualitative Research', 'Research', 'Dutch', 'Sociology', 'Curriculum Design', 'Teaching', 'Lecturing', 'Teacher Training', 'Social Sciences', 'English']
summary:
My professional career is characterized by a focus on local and global diversity and inequality issues, with a special focus on education. I like to contribute to a more socially just world where people and their diverse histories, contexts, needs and rights are recognised, valued and respected, and I believe education plays an important role here.
In my work I mainly focus on researching, transforming and innovating inclusive (educational) processes, content and professionals.
I currently work as a senior researcher at the Verwey-Jonker research institute, where I coordinate and implement projects in the fields of education and youth, social justice and inclusion.
Before that, I worked for almost ten years as a teacher, curriculum developer and researcher at the University of Amsterdam (UvA): the Academic Teacher Training Program (UPvA) and the Educational Sciences department. I worked on (practice-based) research and development projects in the field of student teachers, diversity, inclusion and equality.
In 2013 I completed my PhD research at the UvA. For my PhD research I worked from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, together with the research group NEGRAM at the State University of Rio de Janeiro (UERJ). My PhD project focused on ethnicity/race issues and curriculum changes in primary education in Brazil, for which I did extensive fieldwork in Rio de Janeiro, NiterÃ³i and BrasÃ­lia.

Na mijn universitaire studie Algemene Sociale Wetenschappen ben ik o.a. bij een werving- en selectiebureau gaan werken. Na een paar jaar wilde ik het onderwijs in. Ik heb de verkorte Pabo (met Dalton-certificaat) gedaan en werk momenteel alweer bijna 10 jaar als leerkracht in het basisonderwijs. Ik heb me gespecialiseerd in onderwijs voor meer- en hoogbegaafde kinderen. Naast een reguliere groep 3, geef ik ook elke week les aan de meerbegaafde kinderen op school. In deze Plusklas breng ik de leerlingen vaardigheden bij die zij nodig hebben om hun talenten ten volste te kunnen gebruiken. summary:
Ik hield eigenlijk altijd al van leren. Hoe leuk is leren? LEGO, de Tina, pannenkoeken bakken, verhaaltjes schrijven, gitaarspelen, de abc-formule snappen, Poulenc zingen, een proefschrift schrijven, en dan het allerhoogste: lesgeven.

Daarom maakte ik van lesgeven maar mijn carriÃ¨re. Als beta-jongetje verdwaald in het taalonderwijs. Als leraar met 30 jaar vo-ervaring in Amsterdamse multiculti-klassen. Als onderzoeker op het gebied van vakdidactiek Nederlands. Als nascholer die graag met collega's nadenkt over hoe dingen beter kunnen. summary:
We staan voor grote transities op het gebied van energie, warmte en onze economie. Dit is niet alleen nodig voor de aarde maar ook voor ons om een leefbaar klimaat te behouden voor de generaties na ons. Door nu stappen zetten om minder energie te verbruiken, om te schakelen naar andere energiebronnen, een economie zonder afval en met aandacht voor biodiversiteit zorgen we voor een betere, gezondere, socialere en veiligere leefomgeving voor de volgende generaties. En voor veel minder kosten dan als we deze erfenis doorschuiven. 

In 2020 ben ik bewust van baan gewisseld om een grotere bijdrage te kunnen leveren aan een betere leefomgeving met acties zowel op kleine als op grote schaal. Binnen de gemeente Barneveld ben ik betrokken bij de thema's circulaire economie, interne duurzaamheid van de eigen organisatie (CO2 prestatieladder), toekomst bestendige bedrijventerreinen en duurzaamheidsaspecten binnen ruimtelijke ontwikkelingen.  

In mijn privÃ©situatie ben ik ook volop bezig met verduurzamen van onze eigen leefomgeving. Zo zijn wij ons huis aan het renoveren met als doel van het gas los te gaan. Daarnaast zijn we onze tuin aan het aanleggen met oog voor biodiversiteit. Het doel is om veel inheemse soorten te planten, groene daken aan te leggen, beschutting voor vogels te creÃ«ren en veel bloeiende planten voor de bijen en insecten. Natuur inclusief!

Duurzaamheidsadviseur - circulaire economie - CO2 prestatieladder - duurzaamheid

summary:
Ik werk al ruim 25 jaar met veel plezier aan milieu- en duurzaamheidsvraagstukken bij de gemeentelijke overheid. Mijn basis is Milieukunde in Deventer en Bestuur-, beleid en management bij de bestuurs-academie. Mijn kennis is uitgebreid door ervaring, cursussen, (natuur)verenigingen en bestuursfuncties. 

Ik geniet er iedere dag weer van om mijn steentje bij te dragen aan het steeds mooier en duurzamer maken de wereld, van Dronten. Mijn intrinsieke motivatie ligt in het behoud van de oneindige mogelijkheden van de natuur. De uitdaging die ik mijzelf stel is 'het minimaliseren van de menselijke invloed op de aarde'. Dat doe ik momenteel in mijn functie van adviseur duurzaamheid bij de gemeente Dronten. Mijn dagelijkse bijdrage ligt op dit moment in de energietransitie, en specifieker in een inclusieve energietransitie: iedereen moet de kans krijgen om mee te doen.

Ik zie snel wat er nodig is, vooral op menselijk vlak. Ik vind het leuk om mijn kennis te delen. Ik ben graag bezig met het verbinden van mensen, plannen, bedrijven, ideeÃ«n en projecten. En met het nÃ²g duurzamer maken van Dronten. Wist je dat in Dronten 173% van de eigen energiebehoefte wordt opgewekt?

Ik ben een generalist en praktisch ingesteld. Vertalen van problemen in mogelijkheden, onenigheid beslechten, analyseren en ontwikkelen van ideeÃ«n geeft me energie. Ik ben een grote liefhebber van afwisseling! En beter in het bedenken van oplossingen dan in het uitvoeren van die oplossingen. Voor de ingewijden in insights: ik ben groen/geel + geel/groen.

Wil je ook aan duurzaamheid werken in Dronten? Wil je onze collega worden of zoek je een tijdelijke baan? Zoek je een stage- of afstudeeradres? Kom eens praten! We zoeken 5 nieuwe collega's en hebben regelmatig leuke opdrachten. Je mag ook je eigen (school)opdracht voorleggen :-)

summary:
Duurzaam worden is doelen stellen en doen. Als opgavemanager circulaire economie ga ik er met mijn team voor zorgen dat Leiden in 2050 helemaal circulair is. Dat alle inwoners anders omgaan met hun aankopen en hun afval, en dat bedrijven anders gaan produceren. Het gaat dus om herhaaldelijke verandering in gedrag, en het systeem te ontwerpen dat daar toe leidt. 125.000 inwoners, 12.500 bedrijven, en dat alles in 30 jaar. Ga er maar aan staan!

Ik hou van uitdagingen en complexiteit. Juist in die setting vind ik de vrijheid om samen met stakeholders en gebaseerd op wat er al is, passende doelen te stellen en de strategie vorm te geven. Of het nu gaat om energietransitie, circulaire economie, klimaatadaptatie of duurzame mobiliteit: ik haal mijn energie uit het inrichten van een programma(team) en de beweging en de resultaten die we onderweg boeken. Waar je mij privÃ© enthousiast krijgt voor het idee van een overtocht naar Noorwegen, zo pas ik in mijn werk ook graag de koers aan op de omstandigheden, maar wel met het doel voor ogen. En ja, soms is dat best spannend en onzeker.

Op ðŸŒ www.gagoed.nl/zichtopcirculair kun je zien wat we in Leiden gedaan hebben en doen aan circulaire economie. Ben jij een koploper in een andere gemeente, provincie of rijk? Of een van die Leidse bedrijven die al bezig zijn? Dan hoor ik graag hoe jullie het aanpakken en hoe we elkaar zouden kunnen versterken!

Duurzaamheid | Programmamanagement | Strategie | Circulaire economie | Energietransitie

summary:
I regard waste to be a temporary 'state' of valuable raw materials that can be fully recycled. It is my goal to protect the world by giving a second life to used materials.
Gilbert
_____

Mission75
Waste management and recycling play a crucial role in the fight against climate change and resource scarcity. Currently, the world economy is only 8.6% circular. According to the latest IPCC report, the temperature will increase by 3.0 Â°C by the end of this century. However, if we can double the degree of circularity of the world economy to 17% by 2032, we will limit global warming to less than 2 Â°C.  

This requires new and innovative recycling solutions in order to be able to recycle the large volumes that are currently landfilled, incinerated or recycled at a low quality. Therefore, Renewi has a mission: Mission75 => to increase our recycling rate to a market-leading 75% and improve our recycling output. 

To realise Mission75, we are continuously looking for innovative and advanced sorting and processing technologies. If you want to innovate with us and get more value out of used materials, please contact us at innovation@renewi.com.

Werken aan een duurzamere samenleving. Waarom? Het uitputten van de aarde en haar fossiele grondstoffen door ons mensen moeten we stoppen. daar zet ik me voor in. Met name het energievraagstuk in de bebouwde omgeving intrigeert me; hoe kunnen we de energie voorzieningen van de woon/leefomgeving verduurzamen? 

Wij gaan ervoor om, voor onszelf een biobased woning te bouwen. Uitgangspunt is: een zo optimaal mogelijk binnen leefklimaat, gebruikmakend van de natuurlijke omgeving.

Mijn missie is om particulieren en bedrijven te inspireren om duurzaam te wonen en te leven. Er is nog veel vervuiling van bodem, water en lucht door het produceren van interieurproducten. Er belanden nog veel producten op de afvalberg waardoor grondstoffen verloren gaan. Met iedere â‚¬ die je uitgeeft kan je bijdragen aan een duurzame en circulaire economie en je impact op de aarde verbeteren.

Mijn ontwerpen zijn eenvoudig en stralen rust uit. Ze geven een gevoel van ontspanning en ik hou er van om intieme hoekjes te creÃ«ren en met kleurvlakken te werken. 
Ik heb voor vtwonen gewerkt maar ik focus mij nu volledig op duurzaamheid. Ik werk graag met verschillende natuurlijke en biobased materialen. Van een tweedehands kastje tot een 3d geprinte vaas van bioplastics, en van een stoel van straat die opnieuw gestoffeerd is tot een bank van Nederlands fabrikaat. Voor iedere sfeer en stijl thuis zijn duurzame keuzes te maken. 

In 2018 ben ik met mijn gezin op wereldreis geweest en was ons thuis overal waar we de camper parkeerden. We zijn in 7 maanden van Amsterdam via Rusland, Centraal-AziÃ« en MongoliÃ« naar Japan gereden. Dat was onze droom en die droom hebben we waar gemaakt. Ik verzorg lezingen over dit thema en wil als spreker anderen graag inspireren om vooral je dromen waar te maken! 

Huidige werkzaamheden: interieurontwerper, stylist, spreker, schrijver.

Al sinds mijn kindertijd is mijn interesse voor de natuur aanwezig en ben ik vaak buiten. Ik heb mij altijd afgevraagd waarom alles in de natuur zo is als dat het is. Om deze reden ben ik Aardwetenschappen gaan studeren. 

Doordat deze bachelor vrij breed is, leer ik van alles wat. Van tektoniek tot bodemkunde en van klimaat tot data-analyse. In het tweede jaar heb ik voor de richting Aardoppervlak gekozen. Onderwerpen zoals glaciologie, hydrologie en de overstap naar een duurzamere wereld om het klimaat te beschermen lijken mij goede uitdagingen. 

Anderen beschrijven mij als een ambitieuze, gemotiveerde en hardwerkende vrouw. Ik kan zowel goed samen als alleen te werk gaan en ben niet bang om verder te vragen.

Daarnaast voel ik een grote verantwoordelijkheid om bij te dragen een betere wereld. Deze dingen komen voor mij samen in mijn studie en ik kijk er sterk naar uit om meer te leren over het klimaat en hoe ik binnen het vakgebied mijn steentje kan bijdragen. 

Ik heb veel mogelijkheden gehad om te reizen en veel van de wereld gezien. In 2018/2019 heb ik een jaar in AustraliÃ« gewoond en gereisd. Ook heb ik het genoegen gehad om mensen te leren kennen met verschillende culturele achtergronden en gezien hoe het leven eruitziet in verschillende landen.

Op het moment werk ik in de winkel Waar als verkoopmedewerker. In de visie van het bedrijf staan duurzaamheid en sociale verantwoordelijkheid centraal. Dankzij deze baan heb ik al veel kunnen leren over de impact van ons koopgedrag op de wereld. name: Sophie van Mil
summary:
Ik rond deze maand mijn master Climate Physics aan de Universiteit Utrecht af. Tijdens mijn bachelor aardwetenschappen (cum laude) merkte ik dat ik vooral gegrepen werd door de geofysica richting; het gebruiken van natuur- en wiskunde om de (klimaat)systemen van de aarde en klimaatverandering te begrijpen. De stap naar Climate Physics was snel gemaakt. 

Daarnaast krijg ik energie van het delen van mijn passies en het enthousiasmeren van anderen. Overal om je heen zie je landschappen die erg variÃ«ren en deze variatie komt tot stand omdat de landschappen zijn blootgesteld aan specifieke condities. Het leren wat deze condities zijn en wat voor invloed ze hebben op het landschap is iets wat op mij op de middelbare school al erg interesseerde en hier wilde ik me verder in verdiepen, dit is de reden dat ik uiteindelijk Aardwetenschappen ben gaan studeren.

Anderen omschrijven mij als een behulpzaam en open persoon. Zo help ik graag anderen met mijn kennis en heb ik bijles mogen geven wat mij erg beviel. Hierdoor ben ik erg nieuwsgierig naar de educatieve minor. Zoals de meeste leerlingen heb ik verschillende docenten gehad en was het mijn ervaring dat, een bevlogen docent, zelfs wanneer een vak je minder goed lag, een les meteen een stuk leuker kon maken.
Dit speelt een grote rol bij mijn keuze om de educatieve minor te volgen, aangezien het mij leuk lijkt de passie voor mijn vak, aardrijkskunde, over te kunnen dragen aan de leerlingen, waardoor hopelijk voor hun het vak ook een stuk leuker wordt.

name: Maria Scheel
field of studies 1: EMBC+: European Marine Biodiversity and Conservation (Erasmus Mundus)
skills: ['metatranscriptomics', 'RStudio', 'amplicon sequencing', 'total RNA sequencing', 'fieldwork', 'Microbial Ecology', 'Science Communication', 'blogging and editing', 'Virtual Events', 'science visualisation', 'Biochemistry', 'Microbiology', 'Arctic ecology', 'Online-Recherche', 'Data Analysis', 'R', 'bash', 'Marine Biology', 'Budget Travel', 'Oceanography']
summary:
My current postdoctoral research utilises various genetic tools and a diverse range of environmental microbiomes, in order to explore community composition, networks and genes.

During my PhD at Aarhus University, I investigated how Arctic soil microbiomes react to the ongoing climate change in terms of rising temperatures, changed precipitation patterns and soil profile disruptions through thermokarsts through next-generation sequencing, thermally controlled incubations and gas flux observations. Furthermore I engage in scientific outreach such as for Greenland Ecosystem Monitoring.

Formerly I graduated in EMBC+: European Master of Marine Biodiversity and Conservation, within which my Master thesis focused on transcriptomic analysis of thermally stressed Arctic copepods. Since then, genetic tools became the baseline and main goal of my research.

I am passionate about creating collaborations across disciplines and with that foster more connection among scientists. As such, I was a representative of APECS Denmark, as well as part of the EGU and APECS Mental Health Project groups. I started the "Mindful Scientist" blog (https://mindfulscientistblog.wordpress.com/) to promote the discussion about mental health in academia and also led a "Mindful Hour" session and talk during the vEGU 2021.

Communicating science engagingly is exciting and needed, so I joined the EGU Cryosphere blog team first as author (https://blogs.egu.eu/divisions/cr/2021/10/22/its-getting-hot-in-here-ancient-microbes-in-thawing-permafrost/), then editor and now temporary chief-editor.

summary:
I am a creative, detail-oriented, and independent person. Living, studying, and working in eight different countries worldwide have honed my skills as a high-level researcher, an educator, English language editor, and an (university) administrator. Through teaching and conducting research in the field of archaeology (specializing in archaeobotany, ancient agriculture and food studies) and in teaching English as a second language (certified TEFL/TESOL), I have become a good critical thinker, problem solver, and project planner. I have planned and coordinated large projects and detailed lesson plans, consisting of large international teams and students respectively from up to 10 countries in a single classroom. Furthermore, I am a strong team player in any work environment.  

I am a dual citizen (American and Dutch), and I have developed my Dutch language skills and have a good working proficiency.  I have worked on several editing projects from masters and PhD dissertations, monographs, book chapters, grant proposals, articles, book reviews, annuals reports, recommendation letters, and all content management and editing of websites for former employers including the Groningen Institute of Archaeology (which uses a CMS) and Meade Laboratory at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL, USA). Since 2012, I have been the English Editor for the archaeological journal Tijdschrift voor Mediterrane Archeologie. I have also taught English at the University of Groningen Language Centre. I am a founding member of the Brussels Institute for Advanced Studies (BrIAS); I have helped build its administrative structure and social media presence (with 900+ followers on LinkedIn) and coordinated several international hybrid-format workshops, lectures, fora, and other events for the programâ€™s pilot phase under the theme â€œThe past, present, and future of food, climate, and sustainability.â€

My current research interests are agricultural economies, archaeobotany (the study of human-plant relationships in the past), crop selection, ethnographic studies of traditional food practices, and food security of both the present day and in the past. My main region of specialisation is the Levant and North Africa, with a particular focus on Jordan, Israel, Egypt and Sudan. I am the senior archaeobotanist on the Tall Hisban, Bayda, Shuqayra al-Gharbiyya, Ghor as-Safi complex (Khirbet as-Sheikh Isa, Tawahin as-Sukkar, Umm Tawabin), Khirbet Safra and al-Jumaiyil excavations in Jordan and Khirbet Beit Mazmil excavations in Israel. I am also an archaeobotanist on the EoS-funded AGROS project.

name: Lindsay Morehouse
position 1: Management & Communications Assistant, Amsterdam Centre on the Legal Professions & Access to Justice
skills: ['Research', 'Editing', 'Microsoft Office', 'Managing Database', 'Museums', 'History', 'Academic Writing', 'Art History', 'Field Work', 'Museum Collections', 'Cultural Heritage', 'Social Media', 'Grant Writing', 'Copy Editing', 'Text Editing', 'Event Planning', 'InDesign', 'salesforce', 'WordPress', 'Instructure Canvas']
summary:
I'm an international higher education professional, with experience in leading projects, coordinating education, and managing research. I have a broad knowledge of international higher education, developed from previous positions within universities, research, and educational institutions in roles such as: Educational program and research group coordinator, student services coordinator, and teaching assistant. 

My educational background is in Classics & Archaeology and I am currently finishing my PhD in Archaeology at the University of Amsterdam. My research looks at the intersection of authenticity, iconography, and memory, using a type of funerary monument as a case study.

Welcome! I am a BSc graduate from Maastricht University with a focus in biological and biomedical sciences. I am working towards gaining further education in the field of Reproductive and Developmental Biology.

Next to that I am working as an aerial sports instructor and am working towards offering my video editing skills as a freelancer. 

Find more about me:
I am a very curious person. I love learning, especially new practical skills. "A jack of all trades and a master of none...". That is a quote I lived by for a long time - but people usually forget about the rest of this quote: "...is still better than a master of one". 
I figured out what I want to be the true master of: The master of using all my different skills in a creative and innovative way to bring on new perspectives and solutions. And making science understandable and more approachable for people. 
If I do not know how to do something, I learn it. And that has brought me to a place where it is easier for me to see connections and pick up new skills. My dad was an engineer and my mother a psychologist so they both taught me since a young age to keep an open mind and try different approaches to problems.

If you would like to know more about me or are simply curious about my future projects - Let's connect!

summary:
I studied history and archaeology at the University of Crete. I continued my studies at the University of Southampton receiving a Master of Science in Archaeological Computing (Virtual Pasts). I was awarded my PhD in Digital Archaeology at the University of Southampton in 2014. 

My research interests are mainly focused on the theory of 3D visualisation, perception and interpretation in archaeology, as well as tools and methods for digital recording. I am exploring the relationship between people and the built environment, while I am particularly interested in the simulation of light in ancient environments.

Much of my recent scholarship also involves reconfiguring academic outputs to elicit non-academic audiences using multimodal means of communication. It explores opportunities to fully integrate Arts into STE(A)M by melding humanities and technology in knowledge transfer, creative collaborations, and partnerships by communicating with the public and making atypical audiences co-creators of knowledge. 

My current project, PURE3D, funded by PDI-SSH, is developing a national infrastructure for the publication and presentation of 3D scholarship.

summary:
Since my early school years, I was truly fascinated with antiquity and the classical civilization, and the greater field of the Humanities in general. This resulted in an ongoing love of language, literature, art and history, a love that still remains undiminished in me.

Having lived in the Netherlands for the past 11 years I had many opportunities to develop intercultural and multilingual communication skills. Besides studying towards the Bachelor's degree and two very demanding Master programmes, I have also worked as a teacher of both Greek and Dutch for 3 years. This experience filled me with even greater enthusiasm for the field of language in general, but also with a special intellectual inquisitiveness and passion for pursuing a career in education.

Since the beginning of 2016, I have been working as a Classics teacher at secondary schools in the Netherlands, where I teach Ancient Greek and Latin language and culture to high-school students (in Dutch). This experience increased my passion for education even more, for I realized I have the ability to inspire young learners about the Classical world the way I was inspired in high-school. Furthermore, I came to realize that working with young adults means so much more than teaching, for it involves guidance, understanding, inspiration and encouragement, as well as recognition of every student's capabilities, talents, and achievements.

As an education professional my ambition is to contribute to youth development with a focus on character formation. I enjoy helping young adults to envision their future and to develop a plan in order to realize their vision. 

My most important aspiration is to be given the opportunity to offer my enthusiasm and passion for 
helping and guiding students in their study choices and support them towards a successful academic path. 
Therefore, I would be very interested in pursuing an academic career as Study Advisor for (international) students at the university level.

name: Nick Van Der Leek
skills: ['Magazines', 'Blogging', 'Photography', 'Editing', 'Photojournalism', 'Publishing', 'Social Media']
summary:
Nick van der Leek is one of the world's most prolific true crime authors. He has published 101 books while operating active YouTube and Patreon Channels for his readers and fans. In October 2018 he also developed, compiled, managed and maintained the popular and definitive CrimeRocket blog, a valuable archive of the high-profile Chris Watts case.

Until recently, Van der Leek was one of South Africa's most successful and active freelancers, with writing and photography work regularly appearing in a diverse stable of publications, including GQ, Finweek, Fitness, Country Life and YOU magazines. He also worked on retainer for SAmen.co.za

In June 2014 Nick published the first of a series of 5 Oscar Pistorius Murder Trial books. By July 'Reeva in her own Words' was ranked #11 on Amazon's Bestseller list. 

Nick van der Leek was invited to London to present a paper to the London Symposium on Climate Change at the Oxford and Cambridge Club in June 2013.

He has worked as the SKA's official photographer and media service provider during the first quarter of 2013. The SKA is one of the world's largest and most sophisticated scientific projects.

Nick is a prolific and versatile photojournalist with a client portfolio that includes Mercedes Benz, Harmony Gold, The Free State Provincial Government, The Blue Train etc. Nick has written for a diverse portfolio of magazines, visit his blog (www.vdleek.blogspot.com) to view recent work.

Nick has photographed and/or interviewed numerous experts, sports stars and celebrities, including Morgan Freeman, Sir David King, Tyler Hamilton, Miss World 2009, Gavin Hood, Chris Froome,  Chad Le Clos, Professor Tim Noakes, Dr Ross Tucker, Ronnie Apteker etc. 

Nick has a background in developing media content (writing, photography and video), economics,  teaching, sport and content management. Nick is currently working on a dystopian fantasy set in Scotland and Africa which he intends submitting for publication soon.

In another life Nick completed several half Ironman and Ironman events and performed at a provincial level in  football, swimming, biathlon and triathlon. 

To book a shoot, or share YOUR story, contact Nick at 072 821 9387 or email nickvanderleek[AT]gmail[DOT]com. 

Specialties: True crime narratives, true crime analysis, statement analysis, stastical analysis, criminal profiling, criminal psychology, photojournalism, financial journalism, technical writing, travel writing and content creation [YouTube, Patreon, Wordpress, Amazon KDP].

name: Corinne Hofman
skills: ['Social Sciences', 'Archaeology', 'Archaeological field excavations', 'multi-disciplinary research', 'co-creative research', 'community engagement', 'Research', 'Higher Education', 'Teaching', 'Training']
summary:
I am a professor of Caribbean archaeology with a focus on the Indigenous history and traditional knowledge practices of the region.  

The indigenous Amerindian past of the Caribbean region is hidden in a vulnerable soil, which is under constant threat of natural disasters, climate change, looting and illegal trade, economic pressures, tourist development, and a lack of heritage awareness. Insufficient effective legislation for the protection of heritage in many of the islands leads to the destruction of archaeological heritage and the loss of knowledge about a crucial episode in global history: the unwritten history of the Indigenous inhabitants, whose descendants were the first to come eye to eye with European colonizers in the Americaâ€™s.

Until recently, the transformations and responses of Indigenous societies to changing natural, cultural, social, economic, and political environments triggered by European invasion and colonialism were largely unknown. The study of the Caribbean archaeological record and the transdisciplinary research conducted by the ERC-Synergy project NEXUS1492 (2013-2019) has provided fresh insights into these infamous histories by uncovering the Indigenous perspectives hitherto overshadowed by dominant Eurocentric viewpoints. The CaribTRAILS project, continues on this important work at the KITLV.

Through comparative research with regions that have similar colonial histories, CaribTRAILS aims to place Indigenous Caribbean history in a global perspective. The project thereby aims to contribute to the debate on decolonization practices; human rights of Indigenous peoples and the social adaptation to climate change; the confrontation between ethnic groups, cultures, and religions; and issues related to changing social relations, inter-cultural dialogue, social cohesion, and diversity in an increasingly globalized world.


I am also one of two local organizers ("champions") for the upcoming edition of EuroScience Open Forum, to be hosted in Leiden in summer 2022. For more information, see: https://www.esof.eu/about-esof/

name: Matthijs Catsman
skills: ['Onderzoek', 'Redactiewerk', 'Engels', 'Italiaans', 'Archeologie', 'microsoft office (word, excel, access)', "Foto, illustratie en publicatie programma's (GIMP; Inkscape; Scribble)"]
summary:
Als junior archeoloog neem ik deel aan de gravende projecten (proefsleuven, opgravingen) van VUhbs Archeologie. Hiervoor voer ik zowel voorbereidende als uitvoerende taken uit in de logistiek van deze projecten en de interpretatie en administratie van de velddata. Daarnaast verzorg ik de verslaglegging van kleine tot middelgrote projecten, van evaluatie tot definitieve rapportage.   

My own research focusses on the proto-historical archaeology of central Italy (Latium Vetus) during the Early Iron Age till Archaic period (ca. 800-500 BC). My main research subjects concern the social structures and relationships constructed through funerary practices and the interconnectivity reflected in funerary material cutlure. 
I have participated in multiple fieldwork projects throughout Italy since 2012. Amongst these projects are foremost the excavations at the sites of Satricum and Crustumerium near Rome. Here I have worked as a trench leader at excavations of the Iron Age and Archaic settlement and necropolis as well as the Roman villas at both sites.

summary:
U zult mij leren kennen als een betrokken en ondersteunende trainer en coach. Iemand die goed kan luisteren en door de juiste benadering en vraagstelling tot de kern weet door te dringen en daardoor inzichten verschaft. Ik ben iemand die zowel hands-on als coÃ¶rdinerend wil werken, het liefst binnen een team van gemotiveerde collegaâ€™s. 

Een Archeoloog die trainer en coach is geworden? Ja! En ook nog eens actief in de musical en theater wereld en gek op het menselijk brein en gedrag. En ik combineer al deze ervaringen en talenten om op effectieve en creatieve wijze te zien waar de individu of groep het beste mee geholpen is. Als archeoloog heb ik geleerd om analytisch en creatief te denken, verbanden te zien. Als docent en trainer heb ik geleerd om afhankelijk van de vraag de beste aanpak te kiezen, en zelf of extern de oplossing te bieden, maar altijd de regie te houden. En mijn passie voor mensen en theater brengt gedrag, emotie en creativiteit samen waardoor ik op doeltreffende wijze mensen weet te boeien en te motiveren.  Het ontwerpen en geven van interactieve trainingen is iets waar ik veel energie van krijg en mijn creativiteit in kwijt kan. 

Na een jaar met veel energie en passie de trainingen voor de GGD te hebben gedraaid ben ik op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging. Het onderwijs trekt mij vanwege mijn affiniteit met jongeren, maar ik sta open voor leuke nieuwe kansen, dus weet je iets dat bij mij zou kunnen passen dan hoor ik het graag!

summary:
Constance van Berckel is an independent curator, event organizer and entrepreneur. She is active in the international art scene, having worked in Los Angeles, Berlin, London and Amsterdam. She has extensive experience on the commercial side of the industry, as well as on the more experimental and conceptual side of the art scene. 

In 2017 she founded Art Tours Berlin (www.arttoursberlin.com), an art tours and events company through which she organized a great number of art tours, events, talks and panel discussions. The company grew to 10 employees, with a strong presence in both the Berlin and London art scenes. Art Tours Berlin was passed on to new directors in 2020, and it continues to flourish. 
She then founded AXS ART (www.axs-art.com) in 2018, an online gallery for art by emerging artists, aimed at starting collectors. The goal of AXS ART is to provide greater access to art collecting, by bringing young art buyers and artists together via its e-commerce platform and Instagram, as well as through regular pop-up exhibitions.

Most recently, she organized the exhibition with an elaborate events programme titled â€˜unity | duality | trinityâ€™ at De School in Amsterdam. She is currently working on various projects as a curator and event program organizer. Furthermore, she is working on founding a digital artist residency that is scheduled to launch in the spring of 2023.

The projects she has led lie on the intersection of art and digital technology, presenting art in an interdisciplinary context, where the viewer/visitor is invited to explore how we as humans connect to each other and the world around us. 
Constance consistently aims to extend the access to art and the art world to a wider, more diverse audience, and create environments that are connecting and unifying in nature.

Most recently he worked at Hivos, where he was in charge of the global grantmaking program on arts and culture. During these years he was deeply involved in cultural sector building in North Africa, West Asia and East Africa. He set up Digital Earth, a research fellowship that provides support for artists and designers as they explore questions related to digital futures. Arthur is editor at Vertical Atlas, a new atlas to help us navigate the digital geopolitics of the world today. summary:
Currently, I am an Artificial Intelligence student at the VU Amsterdam in the third year of my study. 

I am currently the vice-chair of the USR (University Student Council) of my university where I mostly focus on team management, work overview, training and professionalisation (including evaluation) of the council as well as sustainability (especially in relation to the impacts of animal agriculture). I am also a support portfolio holder in Research and Education as well as Public Relations and Internationalisation. 

I also work as a Teaching Assistant at my university where I give tutorials and classes to students from years below me in the subjects I am most passionate about. This consists of preparing classes as well as presentation and explanation skills for problem solving oriented exercises in the fields of Artificial Intelligence, Mathematics and Computer Science.

Last year, I was the chair of the communication committee in the student council of the science faculty at my university, where apart from making sure other committee members stay motivated and bringing new ideas to the table I mostly focused on work regarding student contact/feedback such as polls and questionnaires and opinions as well as event organization or international student support. As a part of my position I was also the Ambassador of the Green Office VU where I worked as a liaison between them and my faculty as well as helped them with generating new ideas or projects to work on to improve the sustainability of the university. 

Previously I have been a member of scouting organizations for over 6 years where for a major part of this I took leadership roles. I have also worked as a mathematics tutor for various age groups (from primary school to high school) over the years as a side job to financially support my study. I am highly motivated and easily adaptable to change, as I dedicate my efforts to making the world a better place not just for humans, but for the rest of its inhabitants which is my main driving force. For that reason, my passion for what I do grows stronger every day becoming my great asset.

I have obtained education across multiple different systems in Poland, The UK and the Netherlands allowing me to have a broader international perspective on the current state of European academia.

I spend a lot of my free time looking for ways to engage in animal activism as well as actively working on my personal lifestyle to minimize my environmental footprint, as well as cooking, gardening and  searching for alternative ways to improve my local community.

I have a bachelors degree in Cognitive Science and Artificial Intelligence at the university of Tilburg. Throughout my learning journey, I have developed a huge passion for data analytics and using machine learning to help make crucial business decisions. I am currently pursuing my master degree in applied statistics at the university of Strathclyde, hoping to deepen my understanding of the many ways used to analyse data.  

Experiences:
1) Machine Learning: Linear/ridge/lasso regression, KNN, Naive Bayes (multinomial), SVM (Linear and RBF), Logistic Regression, Decision Tree (Gini and Entropy), Random Forest, Gradient boosting, XGboost, and K-means clustering. 
2) Deep Learning: Loss functions, Optimizers, MLP, CNN, RNN, LSTM, Transformers, Variational Autoencoders and Generative Adversarial Nets.
3) Computational Linguistics: Regular Expressions, NBC, N-grams, edit distance, Markov Model, Hidden Markov Model, Part of Speech Tagging, Word2vec, lemmatization/stemming, Parsing, and Viterbi algorithm/dynamic programming.
4) Fluent languages: Python, R, C++, and T-SQL.
5) Languages I have worked with in the past: Python, C++, MySQL, JavaScript, R, HTML/CSS, and Prolog. 
6) Language: English, Chinese, Malay, and Cantonese.

Since May 2020 I have been working as a Senior Artificial Intelligence Scientist at Trifork, located in Eindhoven. Within this company I have been fortunate enough to be part of different software application projects which allowed me to adopt different kinds of roles, such as data scientist/engineer, AI algorithm designer, and programmer. During this time I have embraced several new skills, such as becoming acquainted with Unity and Azure, as well as learning more about creating computationally optimized machine learning models which should be deployed to an edge device. I also like to explore capabilities beyond my AI and programming skills, both technical and soft, in order to continuously develop myself into an allround and multidisciplinary project team player.  

Previously I have worked for almost 4 years as a technical software consultant at Alten Technology and 2 years as Artifical Intelligence Scientist at TKH Innovations. During these years I have participated in several data science/ machine learning and algorithmic optimization projects, for companies such as Vanderlande Industries, TKH Security and VMI. 

I have obtained both my Master's and Bachelor's in Artificial Intelligence at the Radboud University Nijmegen. In the Master program I have followed the Cognitive AI trajectory, with specific focus on machine learning, data science and human technology interaction. For my graduation I have completed a research internship and thesis at Philips Research, on the topic of automatic psychological profiling based on natural language use. 

I am interested in a wide area of AI topics, specifically machine learning, and other optimization algorithms, computer vision, mathematics and human-machine interaction.

After my graduation I have travelled through the beautiful country of New Zealand for 2,5 months.

summary:
I'm an idealistic nerd with a passion for life. As an all-round web adventurer and driven entrepreneur with an affinity for security and AI, I have extensive experience in all areas related to â€˜World 3.0,â€™ and have worked with clients from all facets of society since the age of fourteen. My natural curiosity and research-oriented education put me on top of the most recent trends and developments within the field of Artificial Intelligence. I am especially intrigued by natural language (processing) and explainable AI, and my combined disciplines uniquely suit me for studying these areas. As an active participant in societal debate, I also got acquainted with politics and dealing with media.

While back home I enjoy the luxury of tweaking and hacking on my laptop, I also have a lust for traveling to extraordinary and controversial places like (post-)war zones and remote regions. Doing so, while mostly hitchhiking and at times having to cross dangerous borders and enjoy the support of privileged locals, I have reported on child prostitution, corruption, and outright poverty. I am especially inspired by the former Soviet region, and, through a second academic career and very extensive travels across the entire CIS region, I have developed a solid understanding of their cultures, histories, literatures, and contemporary societies. By predominantly staying with local residents, I developed numerous short-term relationships with people from all social layers: from high officials to poverty-stricken families. An ingrained interest in â€˜the strange and unknownâ€™ has brought me to many of the countries' (war) ruins, factories, biolabs, chemical (and nuclear) dumpsites, indigenous communities, and â€˜off-the-beaten-pathâ€™ nature areas.

Although it might sound odd at first, perhaps my greatest achievement in life is that I expect to complete nine years of study (two Bachelor's degrees and two Master's degrees) within a nominal timeframe. I spent almost two years traveling abroad and lost both my father and mother at different moments in time (2016 and 2019). In the last three years of studying, I managed to catch up entirely by working up to twice the nominal load, all the while still maintaining a social life and various employments; without sacrificing my academic achievements.

summary:
Heading the UNICRI Centre for Artificial Intelligence and Robotics with more than 19 years of experience in leading multilateral negotiations, developing stakeholder engagement programmes, as well as scientific and technical cooperation, with governments, UN agencies, international organisations, think tanks, civil society, foundations, academia, private industry and other partners on an international level focused on impacts, opportunities and challenges of rapid technological change and innovation on sustainable development. 

Since 2014, Initiated and managed the first United Nations Programme on Artificial Intelligence and Robotics. Initiating and organizing a number of high-level events at the United Nations General Assembly, and other international organizations. Finding synergies with traditional threats and risks as well as identifying solutions that AI can contribute to the achievement of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. He is responsible for initiating and organizing the UNICRI training, educational and mentoring programmes worldwide on AI and Robotics for a wide range of stakeholders. 

He is a member of various of international task forces and working groups advising governments and international organizations on numerous issues related to international security, scientific and technological developments.  

In 2013 Initiated the establishment, and coordinated the work of the United Nations Group of Friends of CBRN Risk Mitigation and Security Governance among permanent missions of the UN in New York.  

Prior to joing UNICRU served as a special projects officer at the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) undertaking extensive missions in politically sensitive areas around the globe, and contributed in global anti-terrorism efforts to fight against chemical terrorism. 

Recipient of recognition on the awarding of the Nobel Peace Prize to the OPCW in 2013.

name: Peter Wassenbergh
summary:
Hello network,

My name is Peter Wassenbergh and I am a hard-working family man. 
I have always enjoyed working as an engineer in several companies where process controlling and improvement, troubleshooting, quality assurance and stakeholder management were key factors in my day to day job.

On the workfloor, I am always willing to help and guide my team, and am perceived as a friendly but hard-working colleague. Working in teams allows me to connect with colleagues of all levels and disciplines, making my work interesting and challenging.

What I enjoyed doing most was organising and guiding production processes alongside managing my projectteam to obtain the best results and meet deadline requirements. Creating work instructions based on technical drawings as provided by our customers and implementing these by properly instructing and guiding the team are examples of my day to day responsibilities. Additionally, I provided the sales team with a cost calculation of production and joined them in customer meetings where more technical and quality-related input was required. At the back-end, I performed quality control and reported back to customers about any deviations. 

To perform these tasks successfully, I always work very accurate and make sure to communicate timely and effectively. Although I am very accurate, I do not get lost in the details. Keeping an overview at all times to ensure progress was made was one of my strong suits. 

In my next challenge, I would prefer a combination of process and quality control as well as maintaining customer contact. Creating work instructions and first article inspection reports are still my key interests and what I enjoyed doing most. 

Please feel free to take a look at my page and reach out in case of any questions or possible opportunities.

name: Industria Congress
skills: ['Innovation management', 'Time Management', 'Innovation Management', 'Industrial Engineering', 'SPSS', 'Logistics', 'Entrepreneurship', 'Operations Management', 'Statistics', 'Supply Chain Management', 'Business Process Improvement', 'Event Management', 'English', 'Project Management', 'Venue Search', 'Research']
summary:
In 2023 the Industria Congress will take place on the 21st of November for the 40th time!

The Industria Congress is set up for Industrial Engineering students from the Eindhoven University of Technology. About 200 students participate in this congress every year. As the board of the Industria Congress we would like to offer these students a chance to get in touch with companies for a possible bachelor's end project, to graduate during the master's, for a traineeship, or for a permanent job. 

For companies, this event is a unique opportunity to get in touch with enthusiastic students from the University of Technology Eindhoven by giving interactive workshops and many more different ways of collaboration. On top of that, there will be two plenary speaker sessions during the day and we will close with a small drink.

The Industria Congress is organized every year by a new board and with a different theme. For more information, you can visit our website: industria.tue.nl/congress. 

Feel free to contact us if you have any questions!
