summary: During my time as a professional football player, as well as in the process of chasing this childhood dream, I learned how to work in teams and to push myself to the limit every day, to reach my full potential. Driven by my passion for the interesting world of physics, and supported by the eagerness to learn and a great amount of self-discipline, I was able to combine this football career with my scientific career for a long time. My particular interest in photonics, which was boosted by the internship experiences, translates into the desire to aid in the development and application of this promising field of physics.

name: Oriol Pomarol Moya
skills: ['Machine Learning', 'Data Science', 'Python', 'Communication', 'Teaching', 'R (Programming Language)']
summary:
My name is Oriol, and I am a MSc graduate in Applied Data Science currently working at Utrecht University (UU) for the Department of Physical Geography.

The focus of my research at UU is the application of Machine Learning (ML) algorithms to predict and understand geophysical processes. My ongoing case study is the desertification of semiarid hillslope ecosystems, in which I have applied different ML algorithms to simulate the aggregate behaviour of vegetation and soil, using data from spatially detailed simulation models. The results outperform previously used expert-based models, enabling an evidence-based analysis of the desertification mechanisms.

I am most proficient in Python (numpy, pandas, tensorflow, matplotlib...), but I am also well-versed in other programming languages such as R and Fortran. In my master's degree in Applied Data Science, I have acquired a broad knowledge of Machine Learning including text, image and video analysis; the use of mixed models in epidemiology; geostatistics and spatially dependent models; deep learning including artificial neural networks and convolutional neural networks among others; network analysis, etc. 

My scientific background in physics and analytical mindset proves key to problem-solving, and I am always ready for a challenge. In my professional experience as a secondary school teacher, I learned to communicate efficiently and express complex topics in an easy-to-understand way. I have also had to cooperate extensively with my peers both in my studies and work environment, which I have been able to tackle with an open mind and respectful attitude. Working as a teacher while studying has also taught me to have good organization and time management.

In the future I would like to continue working on new applications of Data Science and Machine Learning, especially in Science, but I am also interested in other topics like Science communication or the ethics behind AI.

summary: I am a Master's student in mathematics and physics at Radboud University. My main interest lies in the mathematics behind theoretical physics, and subsequently how it gives rise to physical models. In 2021 I graduated cum laude for bachelors in applied mathematics and applied physics, where I did my bachelor's thesis in general relativity. Although my interest in mathematical physics is rather broad, mathematical relativity has a special place. I think general relativity is one of the most beautiful theories where the mathematics and physics support each other. As a master's student, I learn about mathematical physics every day and I would love to continue doing this by doing research in this field.

My full name, is Silke Gerlofke Zwart.  I was born on the 26th of October 1997 in a small village in the northern part of the Netherlands. Family members, friends and acquaintances usually describe me as open - minded, enthusiastic, social and emphatic person. I'm always open to feedback and very loyal. I like to write and take walks, but I also adore listening to music and having deep conversations!

After finishing my high-school, I took a gap-year and worked full-time in a retail store. Moreover, I volunteered in a nursing home. Then, I moved to Zeist, to start a bachelor humanistics, a combination between philosophy and religion.

Currently, I'm studying political science at the Radboud University. I volunteer for the local Green Party. Lastly, I am a proud member of an international debating society, where we debate weekly on various topics. I helped organizing some tournaments and have been the vice - chair of this society.

Daarnaast heeft de bachelor politicologie mij getraind in het analyseren van situaties, beleid en de publieke sector. Het opstellen en doornemen van (beleids-) documenten/notulen, of ideeÃ«n en advies op een correcte manier uiten is mij daarom niet vreemd. Nu ben ik klaar om mijn kennis in de praktijk te brengen, en een actieve bijdrage te leveren aan de ruimtelijke ordening. Met de combinatie van politieke en planologische kennis, mijn passie voor ruimtelijke ordening, en mijn brede oriÃ«ntatie binnen aangrenzende disciplines, denk ik een goede aanvulling te kunnen vormen voor uw team binnen de publieke sector.

name: Josien Paeper
skills: ['Microsoft Office', 'Social Media', 'Engels', 'Nederlands']
summary:
Ik ben Josien Paeper. Ik ben zojuist afgestudeerd bij de Master International Politics aan de KU Leuven. De jaren hiervoor heb ik de zowel de bachelor Political Science als de bachelor Economics and Business Economics afgerond aan de Universiteit van Amsterdam. Ik vind het waardevol om vanuit verschillende perspectieven te kijken naar wat er speelt in de maatschappij. Door mijn analytische blik en oog voor detail vind ik het leuk om nieuwe onderwerpen mij eigen te maken en structuren door te lichten.

Afgelopen jaar heb ik mij beziggehouden met het verbeteren van mijn Frans, onderzoek naar de Raad van Europa en de wereld van ontwikkelingssamenwerking en dit jaar heb ik mij onder mogen dompelen in de Vlaamse en Belgische maatschappij met alle cultuurverschillen en toch ook een internationale omgeving. Je leert navigeren tussen culturen en denkbeelden, dit zijn vaardigheden die ik de rest van mijn leven met mij mee draag en die ik graag inzet. 

De innovatieve kracht van bedrijven en mijn bewondering voor het ondernemersschap maakt dat ik het nu onwijs leuk vind om aan de slag te gaan als bedrijvenadviseur voor het MKB. Growing a better world together met de coÃ¶peratieve kracht van de Rabobank.

I am Josien Paeper. I just graduated from the Msc International Politics at KU Leuven. In the previous years, I obtained the Bsc Political science and the Bsc Economics and Business Economics at the University of Amsterdam. I have learned a great deal about intercultural communication, analyzed problems in both a quantitative and a qualitative manner and researched the EU's Foreign Policy,  the Council of Europe and Development practices. Next to this, I have improved my French to the B1 level. 

-	Political Science Graduate
-	Economics & Business Economics Graduate
-	Great analytical skills and attention to detail
-	Fascinated by structures in society and the private sector
- Advisor for SME at Rabobank

name: Lourens De Vries
skills: ['Lecturing', 'Theory', 'Science', 'Academic Writing', 'Translation', 'Religion', 'University Teaching', 'Teaching', 'Linguistics', 'Research', 'Literature', 'Higher Education', 'History', 'Intercultural Communication', 'Social Sciences', 'Editing']
summary:
The research of the General Linguistics group focuses on the inductive and database-driven typology of language systems, with an emphasis on the empirical cycle where general linguistic typology and descriptive linguistics of Austronesian and Melanesian languages feed and modify each other. 

Since the strength of linguistic typology depends to a large extent on the quality of the grammars which feed the databases, the group has a special interest in all aspects of fieldwork methods and descriptive linguistics from the use of software tools (PRAAT, Language Explorer 8) to standards for data collection and processing, linguistic argumentation and ethical fieldwork. 

And since Austronesian and Melanesian linguistics have a long and strong tradition of cross-disciplinary research focusing on themes shared with anthropologists, archeologists, geneticists, historians and biologists, we also have a special interest in linguistic relationships (areal, genealogical, typological, statistic) as instruments within cross-disciplinary contexts for the study of human prehistory and population movements. Our focus here is on the prehistory and migration paths of the ancestors of Austronesian, Melanesian and Papuan speech communities.

summary: I started my academic career at VU University (Amsterdam), where I obtained a Bachelorâ€™s degree in Latin and Ancient Greek Language and Culture. Having spent a year at KU Leuven University on an Erasmus scholarship during the initial stages of my education, I decided to return to Leuven for a master's degree in Linguistics, which I obtained with a specialization in Diachronic and Comparative Linguistics in 2016. Subsequently, I joined the Friedrich-Schiller-UniversitÃ¤t (Jena) as a Marie Curie Early Stage Researcher in the DComm project, studying for a PhD degree under the supervision of prof. Holger Diessel. In my thesis, which focused on demonstratives, I combined a typological investigation of demonstrative systems worldwide with a more in-depth study of the Latin demonstratives. Having finished my thesis, I joined the University of Amsterdam in September 2019 as a postdoctoral researcher in the Anchoring Innovation project, focusing on Latin. In my work, I aim to combine my knowledge of general linguistics and pragmatics with my passion for Ancient Greek and Latin literature.

summary:
I am a freelance all-round editor and translator of academic English texts and English fiction. I primarily work in British English, but I also accept American English assignments. I translate English - Dutch and Dutch - English. Even though I am a Dutch native, I've started learning English from a very early age and have mastered the language at a native speaker level. I am actively looking for freelance assignments or employment as a translator and editor. 

Actively looking for:
- Copy, line, and developmental editing, proofreading assignments of academic English.
- Copy, line, and developmental editing, proofreading assignments of English literary texts.
- Copy, line, and developmental editing, proofreading assignments of English commercial texts.
- Translation assignments of academic texts, English-Dutch or Dutch-English
- Translation assignments of literary texts, English-Dutch or Dutch-English
- Translation assignments of commercial texts, English-Dutch or Dutch-English

I accept copy editing, line editing, developmental editing, and proofread assignments of academic English texts within the humanities. Developmental editing includes support with the understanding of complex primary and secondary literature, improving the argumentation and overall readability of the text. I work with texts according to the MLA, CMS, and APA style guides. 

I accept copy editing, line editing, developmental editing, and proofread assignments of English fiction of all genres. With fiction, developmental editing includes support with plot structure, character arcs, the overall readability and flow of the story, whether your foreshadowing pays off or is too obvious, and whether you hook the reader sufficiently for them to keep reading between chapters. I also accept texts that aren't strictly fiction, such as blog posts, websites, letters, etc. 

I accept translation assignments in the above criteria, both Dutch to English and English to Dutch. 

I am an avid reader of both classical and genre fiction. I also hope to someday publish my own novel. While I spend my days of filling page upon page with my own stories, in my professional life I support writers of novels or writers who write about novels, history, philosophy, and language within the humanities, or I help people like yourself find that perfect book in their local library or aid in the conservation of historical texts in research libraries or archives.  In this manner, my whole life can be captured between the pages of a book.

name: Stan Majoor
summary:
dr. Stan Majoor (1977) is Professor (Lector) Coordination of Urban Issues at the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences (Hogeschool van Amsterdam). He is also the scientific director of the Centre of Expertise Urban Governance and Social Innovationâ€‹. Previously he worked as Programme Director, Assistant Professor, Post-doc and Junior Researcher at the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences, University of Amsterdam, research center AISSR (Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research).
His research interests are in governance puzzles regarding complex urban issues on the crossroads of spatial, social and economic domains. 

Between 2008 and 2012 he was Program Director of the Bachelor in Human Geography and Planning at the Department of Geography, Planning and International Development Studies and on the board of the College of Social Sciences of the University of Amsterdam.

Since 2001 he holds a Master degree in Urban and Regional Planning, and in Politics and Public Management from the Universiteit van Amsterdam. In 2008 he defended his PhD thesis on three large-scale urban development projects, Zuidas in Amsterdam, Ã˜restad in Copenhagen and Forum in Barcelona and their ambition for 'new urbanity'â€‹. From June 2007 till August 2008 he was Visiting Assistant Professor at the Centre of Urban Planning and Environmental Management (CUPEM) of the University of Hong Kong. He has also had extended research stays in Copenhagen (Denmark), Barcelona (Spain) and Melbourne (Australia).
In 2009-2010 and from 2011 till 2019 he was holding the "Chair Leerhuis" at the Project Management Bureau of the municipality of Amsterdam. From 2013 till 2015 he was the is editor-in-chief of Rooilijn, a popular-scientific journal on policy making and urban and regional planning.
